text: As a non econ major, this was tough class, but interesting. Reading the textbook helps, cause lectures go fast. But if you can stay on top of the material, it's awesome class. Shelton is willing to help if you feel  behind. Go to TA's review sessions, they will save your grade. They're both nice to look at during lecture too.
Nicest professor I have ever had, totally worth taking his class.

Geismer is one of my favorite professors at CMC! I took her Reagan Era history class which obviously discussed Reagan and his policies, but looked more broadly at the culture of the 1980s as well. I didn't feel that the class was skewed one way or the other politically as well. So sad she wont be on campus next year!!
No Comments

I love Prof. Cody. She's sweet, funny, and incredibly disorganized. There is a lot of reading and a few papers, but she's reasonable and willing to accommodate in almost any situation. Attendance is mandatory, but the use of class time has almost no correlation to the assignments. Read the books and start your papers with enough time. Trust me.

If you have not taken calc before, I would be a little weary of taking mistry's class as he can be a bit scattered but overall, such a nice man. I did poorly on a midterm and he gave me 10 points back after I met with him. He is not here to fail you and wants to be as helpful as possible. I didn't learn much in the class but did in my 1:1 meeting.

FHS: Individual, Community, and Culture. A lot of readings assigned (only did most of them), but in class talks are very insightful on readings. Lots of personal experiences shared for discussions and papers- Valenza wants you to share your views no matter what they are. Fun class overall. Lots of music, videos, and art slideshows!

Don't show your liberal side if you have one, your grade depends on it. Regurgitate passages from the reading in class and never stray from the Bush agenda. Don't talk about other foreign policy books that aren't assigned. Rude, rolls her eyes when you speak, refuses to let you talk then gives a bad participation grade. Say what she wants to hear!

I thoroughly enjoyed Prof Livesay's class. He picks some of the most interesting and relevant readings and effectively incorporates them in his lectures and discussions. His grading is fair, and he's always open/willing to help. As with all history classes, there's a lot of reading but you could get by just by skimming. Highly recommend.
GOAT. even the minorities in his class like him although he has been kinda mean toward those kind of people. segregating the classroom is perfectly fine w me tho ��

She is awesome! I was dreading taking chemistry class, and now I am dreading not having her as my teacher.  She is there for the students, and her office hours are fun and helpful.  Take her if you have the chance!!!
One of my favorite professors of all time! This man is brilliant! His lectures/discussions are super interesting. I would take any class that he is teaching.

Very good lecturer, but not willing to answer super specific questions in class. His office hours are the best; very personable and quirky. He'll support you when you need it. Tests are easy, but you need to be on your toes at all times. He's great, just get ready to work.
Feitosa is amazing! If you study hard, you will definitely get the grade you deserved! She was very accessible outside of class, so was the TA. Highly, highly recommend!
His classes are very structured. He's very clear in his teaching, and makes sure to take his time to explain things. He's very helpful in office hours, and he's pretty funny. Great teacher

Prof Wenzel was great to have as an FYS professor! If you showed that you cared and put effort into your work, she really took that in mind when grading assignments. Although class periods were lecture heavy, my overall experience was great!
He is so hard. So hard. But you learn so much. You can hate it while you're in it, but towards the end of the semester, you realize why you took his class. You will learn a lot and reach new levels.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. HE WROTE THE FIRST REVIEW. HE SAYS THE PROBLEM IS STUDENTS. THE PROBLEM IS HIM. He does not teach the material and then gives very difficult exams.

This was my first philosophy class ever and I'm so thankful it was with Dr. B. You can tell she cares about her students' success and puts in so much effort into making her lectures fun, relatable and entertaining to help her students understand more difficult philosophical concepts. She is a phenomenal professor!! PS. Go to office hours!!
Sarah is such a sweet person, and passionate about leadership. She takes suggestions about the class seriously, and responds well to participation and the sharing of life experiences.

I actually really enjoyed this class. I thought the discussions topics were extremely interesting and challenging. He is definitely a hard grader though but very willing to help during office hours. I took this class as a GE and I don't regret it at all.

I am a psychology major and he literally made me rethink my choice! He is definitely very knowledgeable in his field however the way he communicates it to young students is very mundane, bland and uninspiring. A very nice person but grades pretty harshly which is unfair because he is not very clear on what he wants.

Complicates accounting to the highest degree. Think it was impossible to be assigned a paper and be critiqued on writing ability in an accounting class? Think again.  He's terribly confusing in class and easily has one of the largest egos of any professor at CMC. Do not, absolutely DO NOT take him. It's not easier nor better than Massoud's class

He is one my favorite profs. I took the first Jewish-Christian Relations class and learned so much. It was A LOT of reading, but it was doable. Plus he is very excited about his suject, especially the ancient period. Take him when is comes back for Oxford.

In the words of a classmate: "Shaar is an innovator in how to badly teach a class." He just CAN'T teach. He can't explain topics well & blames it on students, he's forgetful and disorganized, and midterms can nuke your grade if you forget to study even one thing. I've never seen someone take an easy class and make it ridiculously hard.

Profesora Martinez is one of the best teachers that I have ever had the opportunity to learn from. Her classes are so much fun and we talk about the most random topics. She's flexible with assignments and tests and there is not a lot of busywork.

This is the worst class I've ever taken. His lectures are weird, scattered and confusing; the textbook is even worse. All the hw is submitted via WebCT so if you miss the window, that's it. The problems are difficult and time-consuming.
Not especially entertaining, but has some good things to say if you can pay attention.

Easily one of the best professors across the 5C. Incredibly engaging professor who genuinely cares about your learning. Her classes are challenging, but you will completely understand every topic you cover. She is also tough grader, but it forces you to really focus on the clarity and precision of your language. Excellent professor!!

Not only does he expect you to read all 7 long political philosophy texts, he suggests that students reread them all before the final.  You should also be sure to attend every single day of boring lecture if you want to do well.

Professor Cohen is far and away the best professor I have ever had. He was also likely the most difficult professor I have ever had.  I learned more in this class than I have in any of my other classes in my 3 and a half college years, and left the classroom after the final knowing that I would always have a mentor and friend in professor Cohen.

Great online teaching, lectures are clear and interesting, relevant to homework, answers questions well. Very accessible outside of class (office hours, email, Slack channel), worth it to attend office hours as homeworks are long and sometimes difficult. I learned a lot, even though the class was online this semester.

boring - literally talked half the class to sleep every time. made me sad except when she brought candy to class. homework was ok, midterms were insanely difficult and unrelated to what we covered in class. no word in English language to describe what final made me feel

I'm personally confused as to why Michon has a 2.8 in terms of difficulty. FHS010 was one of the most unrewarding classes I took because he essentially lectured the whole time and shut down anyone who had opposing opinions and thoughts. I thought the readings and content of the class was enjoyable, but keep in mind that he is a name-based grader.

Sinha is a professor who cares about her students and takes the time to get to know people on an individual level. I took Comparing Social Movements and really enjoyed it. The class covers a lot of material,  is very engaging and encourages participation. She is a no BS professor, so do the reading and be ready to participate. Would recommend.

Professor Yoon is a tough professor, but pretty manageable once you learn what to expect from him. If you study the homework and class examples closely, you shouldn't have a problem with any of the quizzes or tests. He is not very engaging, and it is easy to get distracted because every desk has a computer. Helpful in office hours.

Class isn't as hard as many people make it out to be. He's a chill and really nice guy, but lectures were pretty boring and often not very clear. Class test averages were dismal, but his class is hardly rocket science, and it's on you to put in the hours and effort. Spend at least 5 hours before each test and A's will easily come your way.
you have to do a lot of work outside of class, but overall this class is really good.

Bright and knowledgeable but lecture intensive, dry, boring, and too monotonous. Appears he follows the same script every year. No class intimacy or fun times. Class engagement is dry too, and he makes little effort to break ice. Too many readings - easier to finesse with summaries, that's how I made it.
Great lecturer, great tutor, great friend...highly recommended.

Professor Miller is an extremely knowledgeable and good professor. Lectures can be slow and dry however he is extremely helpful and wants everyone to succeed and do well in his class. Pretty hard grader but gives a lot of assistance in office hours. Interested and concerned with his students and I would highly recommend.

I adore Prof Stergiopoulos. She is one of the most passionate and insightful professors I have ever had. The poets that she selected were consistently interesting and her thoughtful feedback on essays definitely improved my writing. The workload was appropriately challenging yet reasonable. I always looked forward to this class. Highly recommended!
No Comments

He's not clear enough and the lectures are somewhat disorganized. Having said that, he does bring up some neat problems in class and you'll learn how to graph dozens of lines in one graph. But he's pretty damn boring to listen to.
LOVE HIM. HE'S A TEDDY BEAR.

I withdrew from the class after the second midterm and have never been so relieved. Hes a very nice guy but that doesnt compensate for the fact that you will learn absolutely nothing in the class and hate every single second of it. Attendance and participation is not mandatory at all, plus youll end up teaching yourself everything anyways.

One of the best teachers that I've had at CMC! His lectures are very clear, detailed, and he uses many different examples to get the points across. He has great humor and is very helpful during office hours.  Also, the work load is very light and reasonable. I highly recommend him!

Professor Warner is the BEST! While he is a tough grader, I learned the most about writing techniques and reading styles. He gives detailed & amazingly helpful feedback on papers and will 100% greatly improve you as a writer. The challenge in his class was definitely worth it for the amount I learned. He shares his passion for literature every day!

Classes are straight lecture - often boring. 3 noncumulative exams and 1 semester-long project. Study lecture notes for exams and also some textbook (it's about 90% class material, 10% textbook). I took this class thinking it would be an easy A, but I REALLY had to study HARD for the exams. Very nice man and accessible outside of class for help!

Muravchik is a great professor. She goes a good job of conveying information without making it overly complicated. She's also a really lovely person! She's super kind and willing to give you feeback whenever you want. Highly recommend
Good Professor. Really nice and encouraging teacher. Class moves along at an enjoyable but swift pace.

Great Prof, simply the best math or science prof that I have ever taken, but there is one thing that you MUST do if you take an O'neill class:
 
 GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!!! 
 
 I learned nothing in class, but everything in his office.  He is a great 1 on 1 teacher, just bring your homework in and try it with him.

Great professor with crystal-clear lectures (he posts slides online). Tests are easy if you review the material. Not a lot of work and doesn't require you to read the textbook. Answers questions directly and helpful in office hours, however lectures can move pretty fast and be very dry (he just reads off the slides).

By far the worst class I've taken at the Claremont colleges. She couldn't teach a 5 year old how to read. Midterms are difficult, you can get screwed over even if you study. I went to her office hours for clarity, but she's unhelpful. I'm usually an A- student but I struggled to get a C- in this class. Not recommended.

As a prestigious 2.63 GPA Student at Claremont-McKenna College, I'm honored to be writing this recommendation for the Esteemed Dr. Michael O'Nillie. Many people have criticized that his class was too easy at times. However, I believe that stems from their stupidity. Ultimately, this teacher is one that will take a heart attack for your education.

As a lab prof, I would make appointments with her to ask questions and get help on reports. She would flat-out not show up to appointments and made no effort to help. I had to rely on coincidentally meeting other Ochem professors in her office.

You will sweat, get frusterated, and work your ass off at times. But you will learn so much. If you're looking for a teacher to let you sleep through class, don't pick pitney. If you want an engaging class and an experienced teacher- he's your guy. But remember, you have to keep up with all the reading and stay on top of things...

Prof. Nichols is my favorite professor at CMC. He is so passionate about the subjects that we discuss and is always willing to discuss anything if you have questions. That being said, he is not as easy as most civ professors, but he really cares.
This class was awesome.   I thought the subject would be incredibly boring, but this ended up being one of my favorite classes while at CMC.  I would recommend it to everybody.

Took IBC with Sanii and really enjoyed him. I have literally never seen him in a bad mood, even when classes went online due to pandemic. It's a super hard class but he holds recitation sessions, office hours, and always posts his lecture notes online. He will NEVER make you feel dumb, and cares so much about his students. Hard class but worth it!

His lectures and his tests are accurate, I have no idea what the last reviewer was talking about. If you are an intelligent  person the tests are not that difficult at all- I got an A without trying to hard. In spite of the fact that his lectures are all powerpoint presentations, this is probably one of the most interesting classes I've ever taken.

Prof Stacey's intro to Psych class is clearly one of the best classes I have taken. Though she is a touch grader she expects her students to learn as much as possible. She expects her students to read particular chapters from the textbook before each class. I would recommend this class to all those people who are sincerely interested in learning
I only came to class to hear his thoughts.
Just don't do it. Seriously, get another Prof.

First of all, he is a great teacher, encourages you to speak and share! It was fun to be in class.  But, i worked really really hard, and didn't get the solid A.  I took this as a GE.  I don't think there was any chance of getting a low grade... but still, for the amount of work you do, I felt a bit angry when i got my grade.
He's a genius and a stud. Challenging material, but he does a great job teaching it.
i have always hated math and when i took 0308 i started out way overwhelmed but he is always there for you! total sweetheart! i will be taking ANY classes that he offers that goes with my degree.

McGrath is extremely helpful during office hours. His paper topics may seem complex at first, but he helps you talk through ideas and gives plenty of direction. Sometimes class discussions are dry, but the material gets more interesting as the semester goes on. Paying attention to his lectures comes in handy when writing papers. Take notes!

Madame Young is a great teacher. She explains grammer and speaking techniques clearly. She gives daily homework. We had 3 mid-terms and a cum. final. 3 Essays, 2 of which could be rewritten. She is fun, nice and a great teacher.

I think Wells had a rough start to teaching and rubbed people the wrong way. I also think that people don't like physics and take it out on him. I honestly believe he was one of the best professors in the department. He gives lots of homework, but you end up really understanding physics out of it. I highly recommend him. He's a very good teacher.

Threre are daily quizzes on the readings which are easy and the readings are pretty interesting most of the time. The discussions we have in class are very eye-opening. If you're not a history major, it may take some time getting used to her essay format, but go to her office hours and she helps a lot. 4 essays for the semester, but it takes effort

Arndt is nice and funny.  His class is fine if you're good at Econ, hard if you aren't.  He gives reviews sheets & sample questions, but they're not very indicative of his tests, and he even said certain questions wouldn't be on the test and then they were.
The class was pretty hard and there was a ton of homework, but if you work at it, you can do well.  She is also a pretty good teacher who encourages you to contribute a lot.

Professor CC is just plain CRAZY and weird, but her class is easy. I don't feel like I learned that much, but I got a good grade in the class and I enjoyed her lectures for sheer entertainment value (crazy people are funny).
Interesting teacher.  Hard MC portion of his tests, but other than that a good teacher!

Favorite Professor yet at Claremont Mckenna College. Most classes were heavily discussion-based. He is available during office hours and will make more office hours if you cannot meet on his specific date. Truly enjoyed every class. I recommend taking a class with him!!

Great Professor!  Interested in everyone and loves those who can articulate their thoughts and who aren't afraid to be wrong/say they don't know.  Definitely take him for Civ if you want to get something out of this GE.   So good!

Professor Costanzo is one of the best professors I have had at CMC. He truly brings the topic to life in hands-on demonstrations and real-life scenarios. Truly a skilled professor. He is always asking for feedback and truly takes it into account. Take one of his classes!

The class was fast paced, dense, and very quantitative; he breezes over mathematical calculations perhaps bc he was a physics major but I had a really hard time with the math. Prof Yu is super nice and honestly a god when it comes to partial credit. I'd recommend his electives only to quant folks, though corp fin should be fine for anyone.

BEST prof ever! She's so enthusiastic about class and she's great to talk with abt anything, I learned so much from her. Tough essay grader but extremely lenient with deadlines and allows multiple drafts. Assigns lots of reading and don't take her class if you don't want to participate. Class was never boring :)

so nice and accomodating. never gets angry with students and very sweet. not the best lecturer but if you even skim the book you're fine. very fair tests and quizzes. lab is boring but that's not her fault.

Bjornlie really wants to see students succeed. Wonderful in office hours. At least skim all of the readings because he will call on you even if your hand isn't raised. Generally really fun and interesting topics. Shows the show Rome sometimes too!

One of the best intro science professors! He is a very fair grader and is very receptive to student feedback. He is also very approachable during office hours. He puts the fun back into material that can be kind of dry with real-life applications and demos. Take his class!
Did not let us out on time early, not helpful, only teaches in one way, hard to contact. One of the worst classes
Great course, not too difficult if you do ALL of the homework and pay attention in class. Amy Kind is "kind."
very clear and incredibly funny.  i would recommend him if you want a straightforward econ 50 experience.  i also think he's a pretty nice guy.  just follow his system and you'll be fine.

I took Fuc second semester and it was not only much more interesting than Zanella's class, but much easier. He gives you templates for exactly how to solve problems - unless you're a lazy ass - you should be acing his tests. Doesn't take attendance, but if you don't go, youll miss the answers. Honestly, didn't pick up my text book more than 5 times

Leland (previously a Harvard Prof.) is one of the most intelligent professors I have ever had. The class changed the way I look at the world. Discussions are sophisticated and insightful. Students must submit a half page on their thoughts on the reading, for every class. Lowest grade (B) I received last semester, but easily most enlightening.

Great readings - do them on your own. Awful teacher. Pointless essays answering 10 to 20 specific, content-oriented, non-analytical questions on the reading. Class spent answering questions that you JUST did for your essay. Changingambivalent final paper expectations. Pretentious professor. No true academic dialogue - you're expected to conform.

Prof Cody is extremely passionate about what she teaches and has inspired me to take more history classes. She completely changed my perspective of Jane Austen's works through fascinating discussions, lectures, and readings.

Really enjoyed his class, Political Phil Honors. Super interesting class, interesting prof too! Learned how to write really good phil papers.  Hard grader, tough curve.  Don't take his class if you won't attend, he can be nit picky--with things other than attendance too.

He's great! He makes a lot of jokes and is incredibly straightforward. If you can do the practice exam, you can do the actual exam. Really knows his stuff, and helps connect the material to the real world
Lectures are dry, you need to read the textbook for the tests, but he takes attendance. Tests are very detail oriented. Not very helpful in office hours, but he is a nice guy. Not recommended.

I am sitting here with a friend who went to USC and had this prof too and we both thought she was so great. I took her for a GE course that other profs teach too. She's the hardest one but taught a great class and is a lot of fun. I loved talking to her in her office hours, she can talk to you about anything and you'll laugh a lot.

The class consists of very long readings and it is a discussion based class. The professor provides very rude and unacceptable feedback; the feedback consists of insults rather than constructive criticism.
Her grading scale is a bit absurd, and the homework is poorly administered. Not a very helpful teacher at all. But overall, class could have been worse.

He grades on the level system so there are no midterms or finals, but the levels are definitely tricky and he can be very picky. The readings were SO interesting and I loved class discussions. If you go to his office hours he is very clear and it definitely helps! Overall a great prof with an amazing class but can be picky

Prof. Locke is great. He is a terrific philosophy teacher -- he really cares that you learn and that you understand what's going on. His "coach" attitude towards philosophy is helpful for non-majors. He's funny and acerbic, which makes classes fun. No, he's not that easy, but if you were looking to coast thru college, you would have gone to Pomona.

wonderful, sweet woman, but a truly awful teacher. She is one of those people who just has no teaching abilities. Her classes are disorganized, the homework does not match the lectures, and her tests are on material she has not covered. I could learn the material better if I just used the time I waste in class and hw each week on teaching myself
kind is a motherly professor.

Although at times the class was disorganized and had a lot of work, she is an extremely caring woman and if you get to know her (go to her office hours!) she will be very helpful. She assigns a lot of reading but you don't have to truly do it. I really liked her as a professor and think she is very caring about her students

i think he's senile or just lost it. your final grade has nothing to do with the class. it's amazing how he even comes up with these numbers. you learn a lot in the class, which is great and simulation is fun. however, it's really not worth the absurd ending.

She comes across as a really nice lady. Don't let the smile fool you. She believes that everyone took AP Bio when we all didn't. Overall, she's an average teacher but I would not take her again. She is always available outside of class. Although that doesn't mean that she will help you fully comprehend the material. It's up 2 you. Read the book tho

I didn't like this class: grading on papers was very arbitrary and it is true- she doesn't like to admit when she is wrong and she can be very condescending at times, forgetting to be constructively critical.

Very witty professor who made me enjoy Shakespeare, something I never thought I would enjoy reading and learning about. The class atmosphere is very mellow and discussion based. Definitely one of the better classes I've taken at CMC.

Being in Locke's class was great. Class is heavily discussion based. The course is tough but Professor Locke is always available during office hours and there is often a long line waiting. He gives useful feedback and great guidance on how to write your papers

I had Professor Cohen for both lab and lecture and in both sections he was incredibly helpful and direct.  While his style of teaching does not work for everyone, it made a huge impact on me, and made me much more open and engaged with the material than I would have been otherwise.  He truly values the feedback and participation of his students.
Good lecturer and reasonable work load.

While he's definitely a tough grader, I would definitely recommend taking his course if you have any interest in mental illness. You are graded on 3 exams, 3 short (but not easy) papers, and 1 final paper. The exams are tough and require a significant amount of studying, and the papers can be time-consuming. But you will learn a ton!
No Comments

This was one of the most condescending teachers I have ever had. His class is at best hard to follow and poorly organized. He also blatantly lied about how he creates tests saying he wouldn't use the textbook for specific questions, however, in office hours, he told me that he created several questions in direct reference to the textbook.

His teaching style suited me perfectly for ochem but, when I had him during his one semester of teaching gen chem, it didn't transition over very well. He takes a more problem-based approach and, refreshingly, doesn't lecture at you. If you have to take ochem, take Black. Decent lab prof too.

Prof Locke was perfect for my phil GE. he's super nice, super helpful in office hours. Prepare for readings and easy quizzes about every class. his level writing system is tough but if you ask previous students to edit your attempt or give you their attempts, it'll help a lot!

Boring lectures. He makes fun of people and answers questions with rhetorical questions. Although you may hate him, you will realize when you get a different professor how good Fucaloro was actually. His tests are very straight forward

great professor. Engaging discussions. Has a great background and is doing some really neat things. Hard grader and I agree that if you go to his office hours it helps because it then that you know what he wants and/or expects from you.

the class is not difficult but you need to actually learn the course material in order to succeed. textbook was recommended but not mandatory, but if you attend lecture and take notes the reading is not necessary. there were typically quizzes each chapter, with a 3 unit tests in total, and no cumulative final. very charismatic and makes lecture fun
A little unclear and distracted but quite brilliant.  Curses in Italian all the time which is ok since he is Italian.
The lectures are not clear. The class has no structure and we do not talk about most of the readings. Try to avoid taking her if you can. 10-15 page research paper as final

He is a speed demon on the board. Sometimes I think he is going to pass out because he never stops writing. If you like to think about a problem before you do or while you are doing it, DON'T TAKE HIM! He doesn't stop class. He hates answering questions and dominates students who don't understand or question him.

I just had him for lab and he gave very detailed lectures at the beginning of each lab (which would make lab take a long time). He cares a lot about his students though, and as long as you are trying and ask for help, you'll do  really well.

Professor Lobis is a very helpful professor. He responds to emails very promptly. His class can be kind of boring but his friendliness makes up for it. He isn't too difficult of a grader. I would definitely take another class from him.

Charles is clearly really knowledgeable about government and history, but his incredibly high expectations and cold demeanor make it hard to enjoy the class. He doesn't encourage students to ask questions, and often seems surprised when they do. I would definitely not recommend this class.
He is a really good professor!  He is engaging in class and helpful outside of class.  Discussions are really good.  many papers, but you learn a lot.

Everyone gives Professor Wright a bad rap on campus. When I signed up for his course so many people warned me against it; however, I enjoyed his course. If you pay attention in class and take his notes, you have all the information that he will test you on. Plus, he is more than willing to help anyone out during office hours.

Very enthusiastic Econ 50 professor. Take this class if you want a good understanding of the basics of Economics. He will bend over backward to show you how to understand something, and is almost always available for help outside of class. He gives the quiz questions before the quizzes, and so if you do a little bit of work, you should do well.
Prof Spalding is one of the best professors at the Claremont Colleges.  She is smart, nice, and very fair.  I would recommend the DC program just to get a chance to study under such a fine person.

Very knowledgeable and extremely kind, but better as a mentor than a professor.  He's forgetful, picky, and kinda random.  Assigns TONS of reading and papers and grades very hard, you have to do *exactly* what he's looking for.  He'll read drafts of papers, which is helpful.

You may not have any other options, but avoid this professor if you can. His lectures, similarly to the textbook he wrote, make no sense and go on and on without really making a point. Bad at explaining the material and answering questions.
Without a doubt the worst prof at CMC back in 1996 and it sounds like he is still going strong...

Henri Cole is not only an amazing poet, but also a great Professor. His classes are only once a week and for 3 hours, but the time flies by as you discuss poetry and hear about his opinions on life. My own writing ability also drastically improved after taking his class. I highly recommend.
It's not the easiest class because he definitely doesn't take bull, but Krauss KNOWS what he's talking about and is great at instilling interest and facilitating an intelligent,dynamic discussion.

LOVE HER!! She is always willing to help and is very very clear during in-class lectures. She'e not a harsh grader, but I definitely felt like I got a lot out of her feedback on my essays. She also didn't assign too many essays, which was nice. I highly recommend her.
Psych is such BS!

Literally the worst professor and class I've ever had. Lectures and notes are messy and confusing, and he can't explain the simplest of concepts. You learn nothing since the materials are actually middle school level easy (he taught us how to take standard deviations for 2 weeks). Did I mention he also gives zero care about students' well-beings?

Funniest prof I've taken. Also a genuine nice guy under his econ exterior. Only decently prepares his lectures, tends to ramble, but makes them good through poignant anecdotes. Hard subject, easy grader.
Great teacher. KNOWS Roman history like no-one else. Class can get a little boring, but he's an awesome professor, super nice, and really knows his stuff. Took him for a GE and had a great time
Stay away whatever you do. She will torment you with terrible explanations and homework that is so much harder than any of the tests. If you're lucky, you'll get another teacher

Selig is the best. She is so cute, knowledgeable, and draws you into the subject like none other. Very helpful in office hours. History 81 is the best survey class ever if you want American history. Best recommendations...take her!!!

Fantastic professor, if you care to learn about psychology as a science! She works hard to get student feedback. Her lectures are pretty entertaining. Class is not the easiest, but meetings with her were extremely helpful.

Don't let my ratings fool you; I thought she was a great prof. She wasn't a pushover like many of the profs here. Her assignments, reading, and grading were reasonable and interesting. Beware if you don't read: she calls on people that don't talk. She really nice and incredibly smart, though. Highly recommended!
She really knows her stuff. Participation matters!!

What an awful introduction to college physics! In his defense, Professor Wells seems to be knowledgeable about the topics, but he cannot teach in the slightest. The class assumes a great amount of prior knowledge and goes far beyond its MATH30 pre/corequisites. Never take this class, it's tedious, convoluted, and nothing is explained. Ugh.

Took two of her classes in one semester and it was brutal. Probably some of the most work I have done in a Government class. But I learned a lot and she does genuinely care about the quality of her class and her students. Take her class! Just know your gonna have to earn it.

His class is the best I have taken at CMC. He is thought provoking and wants his students to explore the issues raised and to further understand their own beliefs and opinions. He produces good philosophers.

Never has someone conveyed so much information without saying anything. her lectures were basically her talking about how much experience she had in the business world. her expectations were always unclear and graded inconsistently. every class ran at least 5-10 min past the end time. it was a fair amount of work, and i'm not sure what i learned.
The class is not bad work wise, but Ozbeklik can be unclear at times and grading on tests is very arbitrary.

Nice guy but does not teach anything.  I had to learn it all on my own.  Babbals in class a lot.  If you really know your stuff, like really, take him and get an easy A.  If you don't know it you'll get a B but still not know what your doing.

Guthrie is AMAZING!!! One should invest in this course. Although his methods are strange he is a phenomenal teacher and I would not take another professor given the chance. You learn without actually realizing it.

Prof Branch is a cool guy. He is young and has a dynamic teaching style. The class is very interesting and extremely relevant to the world today. It is also very chill, you get the ability to take what you want from the class and won't get penalized if you just want to listen. Prof Branch uses slack very well too and the readings are well selected.

Professor Blitz was a good intro to gov prof, but his lectures were very long and dry (this does mean you don't have to do your reading outside of class though). His grading is decent but does not always reflect the amount of effort you put in. This is a great class to take if you want to get your gov GE out of the way with almost no homework.
Don't take calc 30 with anyone else.

Giulio expects a lot from you, but he is a great professor. His FWS class was interesting yet demanding. He kind of hammered everyone on the first assignment, but don't get frustrated. Go talk to him during office hours - it will help your paper a lot!

He is the worst teacher ever. He only accepts his own opinion and allows for no discussion in class he doesn't agree with.  He assigns 50 page readings and requires you to print out all of them, better stock up on ink and paper! All his class focuses on is Calvinism because he likes it. If you have him for FHs switch out.

Gave a 1 because the system doesn't allow for 0. Absolutely horrible as a professor: doesn't know her stuff, easily loses track of her teaching in class (multiple times over a semester), does zero prep for classes and let the students self-study and teach, no clear grading guidelines and very defensive when asked about her comments. Never take her!
Classes can be boring and lectures can get a bit dry, but Prof O'Neill is always willing to help out any student in need. Truly nice guy!
He's very approachable and helpful, but he assigns a lot of reading.

I took Jasmine at Quest Univ, Canada and I can tell you that she is the greatest instructor ever.  Yeah you have to work hard but she works just as hard. On students' papers she writes pages of clear and helpful comments. Her brain seems full of info, like we all wondered how a head can contain that much. Her insights will blow your mind wide open.
She knows her subject but she is not an engaging professor. Much better in office hours than in class. I personally would nit recommend taking her.

Valenza is a great math professor.  He is very passionate about teaching and extremely helpful.  He encourages questions and is a great person.  He passion makes motivates his students.  Very little hw, tests are not too bad.

This class changed my life. She is SO focussed and helpful, and has a clear direction when it comes to how she wants the semester to progress, with a really good balance of discussions, lectures, papers and a three-class simulation at the end of the semester that replaces the final paper. Class is challenging but worth it. Highly recommend her.

Horribly unhelpful throughout lectures, lab, and just about everything else. He doesn't even seem to have a clear grasp of the material he teaches, so don't expect to learn much or get answers whenever you have a question. Tests were easy and straightforward, but it still doesn't help when he teaches you next to nothing and expects you to know it.

Professor Koch is honestly one of the best professors I have ever had the privilege of taking in my life. She is incredibly knowledgeable, and makes her lectures extremely interesting. I had no complaints whatsoever with this class.

Dr. Smith is amazing. Considering this was a writing seminar, he made it feel like we didn't write as much! He's very funny and inserts funny anecdotes into his lectures. The movies we watched were spectacular and he provided some great insight. This was by far my favorite class and I hope you're lucky enough to take him.

as a person hes probably the funniest professor youll have at cmc and now that im out of the class i love the guy but hes too smart to be teaching entry level classes and is hard to understand a lot, also goes off topic a lot

U.S. Israel and Arabs is definitely worthwhile if you are interested. Otherwise, it would be painful. 3 10 page papers, weekend simulation, and you have to occasionally lead class. Haley knows a lot, but it can be tedious if people just read from notes for their presentations. Paper grading is fair, just if you know what he wants.

Professor Evans really cares about her students. She is super accessible outside of class and a great person to just chat with or get econ help from. Her tests are definitely challenging, but she is fairly generous with practice problems. If you attend tutoring, you are basically guaranteed 100% on the homework. Assigns weekly pre-class quizzes.

Professor Kind is amazing, and I highly recommend taking a class with her! She is absolutely brilliant, assigns interesting readings and does an incredible job fostering discussion. Her class was difficult but rewarding. I definitely recommend her, especially for Philosophy majors!
Great teacher great course. Funny guy, gives out tons of homework, but gives full credit on them all. Tests are hard, but 100% homework grade compensates.

Guthrie is hilarious! You should get a good grade if you come to class and listen. He often recycles questions from old exams, and usually in his review sessions emphasizes things that won't actually be on the exam. Don't bother buying the book, all of his questions will be straight from lecture. Easy and fun to be in class!
terrible. not helpful with homework problems. not good at clear explanations.

Do yourself a favor and don't take this class. I took it because I heard great things about her (great prof and reasonable grader), but after she received tenure, she's gotten so much harder. Unclear with guidelines, arbitrary grading, lots of reading. One of my least favorite classes I've taken at CMC.
Originally I wasn't excited about Civ but professor Valenza made it very interesting.  The class is discussion based which is nice and he incorporates music and videos clips on a regular basis.

Prof Leconte is a barely-average instructor who expects exceptional work from all students. Nit-picky and arrogant, hes the kind of professor who just doesnt want to give As in what is already a tough subject.

Mr. Rosenbaum is AWESOME! He is an expert in his field who really helps you out and helps you to learn the material.  He really exposes us to extremely interesting topics, and runs a really great class! His personality and friendliness make me feel as though the class is one big family at times.

Her tests are based on memorization rather than understanding of the material. Thus makes it hard for certain people. Will judge you based on whether or not you sit in the front or the back of class and if you bring your laptop or not. Very useful during office hours. Somewhat intimidating though.

I would recommend Prof. Evans for any class because of how clear, organized and helpful she is, but especially for environmental econ because of the optional (really) extra materials and readings she provided in an attempt to make the subject relevant. After four years, she is one of the most helpful, accessible and relevant profs I had. A JOY!

Best professor Ive ever had at CMC. Anyone who disagrees just couldnt handle the heat she brings. Would be a waste of your education to not take Levinespecially if a Psych major and/or interested in statistics.
Terrible.
You really have to work to even get a B in the class. She throws stuff on the exam that no one has ever seen before that is really difficult and doesn't curve it. Would not recommend to anyone.

Nice guy, wants to help his students, but tends to assign a lot of reading - know how to scan. Class is a good balance btw discussion and lecture - he has a great amt of background knowledge that supplements readings well. Essays, when graded, were fairly easy in my experience, but that was probably because this was an entry-level writing class.

she is super friendly and passionate, but she does not explain things well at all and her lectures were completely disorganized. Even though i was really excited for the class, she did everything but destroy my interest in cell bio. I love her as a person but she is probably the worst prof ive had at JSD. dont take cell bio with her
Prof Gould is the best!!! Would recommend taking any class he offers.

This has been my best and favorite reading based class I've taken at CMC.  She keeps all of the students engaged and accountable for the material, which helped us get somewhere with class discussions.  I became a better writer in her class.

Professor Von Hallberg is easily my favorite professor and my favorite class. He asks only for 2 150 paragraphs related to the reading each week, and 3 5 page essays. Really teaches you how to connect to what you write and to be more concise, classes are discussion heavy and very interesting.

Such a sweet man! Made film theory interesting and accessible in his Intro to Film summer class. Because it was summer, it was a small evening class and relatively quiet. I imagine in the regular semester his classes are more lively. Would recommend!

Had him for Milton and it is by far my best class this semester!! He's very smart and discussions are always interesting and lively, and he has a good sense of humor. I really didn't expect to like this class but I grew to love it. He is also super accessible and takes time to meet with everyone about papers.
Equally impossible to do very bad and very good.

I've had so many classes from Bradley that I couldn't even fit all of their titles! I consider myself a math/history major with the Bradley sequence... Needless to say, I like the guy. And, if you're in his DE class, I may even be your grader! :)

Youll struggle if youve never taken accounting! You HAVE TO review EVERYTHING or fall behind! Ganguly is an amazing prof though, willing to help, cares for his students, very passionate about acctg which is nice. his class covers more than massoud's. super doable to get an A but u have to dedicate time. participation matters, prepare to learn!

Fernholz is a very clear and reasonable professor. His lectures are always neat, detailed, and available for us. No mandatory reading, 4 homework assignments, a few small reading assignments, 3 quizzes, 2 midterms, and a final exam. He curves heavily on the people at the bottom and lightly on the people up top. Work hard, and you can earn an A.

Quite possibly one of the worst professors. Arrogant, rude, neo-con. She does not care about her students and lets all her coservative views come through in her discussions and in grading you. She is just awful, and unwilling to help with any misunderstandings. Insecure, Condescending. Don't take he

Amazing professor. I have never been as inspired by a professor or by classes as much as I have been with Gary. He is passionate about the subjects and wants the students to do well. There is a lot of reading but you don't really need to do all of it to do well in his classes. Take a class with him if you ever have the chance!
Lower was an incredible professor and introduced me to the discipline of genocide studies.

Going into this class as a freshman made my life very stressful! Although I did very well in the class and on the papers, it was because I put HOURS into studying and writing. On the upside, Busch knows what he is talking about - i left the class having felt I learned so much.
Exactly what the person beneath me said.

One of if not the best teachers at CMC. the most caring and nicest teacher. been teaching for a while so he knows how to teach calc. hw is not necessary to do and tests arent bad if you are good at math. Take him if you can
Crazy expectations for a introductory accounting class. Super difficult concepts that are not clearly defined. Very wordy and hard to follow correspondence, class notes and lectures.
So inspirational, compassionate and dedicated. A really talented Professor, and gives great feedback on writing. Very flexible with writing assignments as well.
bad class ever

Awesome dude. Really wants to help his students learn the material and has a true passion for mathematics. Extremely helpful during office hours - make sure to take advantage. Tests were very manageable. Go to class, do the homework, and study for tests and you will get the grade you want. By far the best math professor I've ever had.

Professor Sanii is an amazing Core professor. He is open to student suggestions and is willing to try new things. As a chemistry professor he provided an interesting perspective on the literature-heavy Core 1 curriculum. He allowed the students to lead and guide class discussions. Overall, the class was a positive experience.
He is one of the best professors I've ever had. He knows a LOT! His class has been very helpful!!!

Pitney is a jerk and hates students who vote the liberal left. He insists on knowing your political beliefs, then mocks you the entire course if you don't follow his ideology. I switched out of a Gov major due to his intolerance for independent thinking.

Professor Kalb's Global South Asia class was the HIGHLIGHT of my semester. She really cares about your success and is very creative in her class structure (lots of in-class discussion and groupwork which helped in creating sense of community in an online class). Lots of reading, but it's def worth it! Can't wait to take another class with her soon!

Overall a great classroom experience. While lectures were a little boring (depending on subject content) he is a helpful prof who general wants his students to invest themselves in the subject matter. Be prepared to read a lot but if you forget listen in class. He is one of the most knowledgeable people I know.

Riggio was not helpful in or out of class. His grading was very unclear and subjective. Although I attended almost all of his lectures, read through his $200 textbook, and did well on the tests, I learned nothing new or useful from this class. Definitely do not recommend.

One of my favorite lit classes I've taken so far. The readings were really interesting and engaging. The classes were a good balance of class discussions and lectures that contextualized what we were reading. She really wants everyone's voice to be heard in class and makes it very easy to participate. Definitely hope to take more classes with her!

Took it for GE but Prof Gilbert totally made want to be a RLST major! Class is lecture based but he raises interesting questions for you to think about. Workload is fair(2 8-page papers and 2 exams w/ study guide). He is super helpful if you go to his office hours to talk about paper or before midterms.

The class was very unorganized and her grading policy is unclear. Intense amounts of reading in an unreasonable amount of time. The class is specifically for first years but she was treating it like an upper-level class. Please do yourself a favor and don't take it unless you truly have an interest in the subject.

Ok this man doesn't know what day it is. All he talks about is how great Sweeden is and how much he wished US students were like they are 'back home'... please. His tests are insane he stumbles over his own words, other students correct him...need I say more? just don't take any of his classes.

Very thoughtful person who pushed me to become a better thinker and a more competent philosophy student. Some of the reading is difficult but Kreines makes a serious effort to make sure everyone is following along. Definitely one of the most intelligent professors I've ever had and I'm seriously considering having him as my thesis reader. Dope guy!

Religion, Politics, and Global Violence was hands down my favorite class of my senior year. Prof. Espinosa did an amazing job of selecting the readings, I found them very interesting and valuable to my understanding of the topic. He was always available outside of class and very helpful on papers and other projects. I definitely recommend the class

Extremely intelligent and knowledgeable. Great at fostering discussion and really teaches IR theory well while keeping it interesting. You have to work hard to get a grade but it's worth all the effort. Final paper is long but if you meet with her to talk about it you'll do fine.

Do not take. She is a very nice person but not a good teacher. All these reviews are saying her lectures are unclear but that's ok? A professor is supposed to give good lectures!! In Office hours she reads off the solution and cannot explain the material clearly. Tests are complete regurgitation + time pressure, odd for a Real Analysis course.

Riggio's lectures consisted of odd stories from when he used to work as a consultant and arguments on why psychology is actually harder than real science. The whole time, it felt like he was trying really hard to prove that what he does matters and that he is intelligent.

as a person hes probably the funniest professor youll have at cmc and now that im out of the class i love the guy but hes too smart to be teaching entry level classes and is hard to understand a lot, also goes off topic a lot
He is nice. Lecture is a little bored. He knows more than he talks.

Professor Binay has difficulty maintaining control of his class and his lectures are tough to follow. Personally, he is a good guy and very friendly. I did not learn a great deal in this class but the investment projects yielded some interesting insights.
He's very accessible, caring, and, at times, rather amusing.

Prof. Halpern is a wonderful human-being. She is the top of her field (in sex differences) and many of the articles we read cited her work.  Excellent and enjoyable class- and she gives you a rice-krispie-candy break for tea :)

Prof Meyer is a very eccentric prof, no doubt about it. She is also very serious about lit, so if you take her class take it seriously. And if you like Dante, you must take her class. I personally was reluctant to take Dante, but she opens your eyes to his brilliance. One of the hardest and most stimulating lit classes I took at CMC.
Lectures are dry, but much easier to follow if you have done the reading. He went out of his way to help me complete the class after problems in my other courses put me way behind.

For a lecture-type class, there was lots of class discussion and he made the material seem really easy. It also helps that he uploads the lecture notes online if you have to miss class. He's super nice and the midterms and finals are exactly like the homework assignments.

Like Prof Massoud, Prof. Pitney is one of the institutions that make CMC what it is. If you are a Gov major, you must take his class. US Congress is one of the most fun classes, and will teach you the nuts and bolts of how politics works. He may seem stiff one-on-one the first time you meet, but he warms up and would do anything for his students

Professor Lower seems like she would be a good researcher, but did not run her class very well. She was not clear of her expectations for assignments, assigned massive amounts of reading that was never discussed, and was not consistent or clear in grading assignments.

Taw is a real gem, & I recommend this class (War) to everyone. You will read a sh*t ton of books, & write so many papers, but I have never taken a more rewarding class. And a bit about Taw: she is SO intelligent & brings so much to discussions without being overbearing; she is sweet but tough; she gives a lot of help at her office hours. Love her!
He's alright. Lectures were very boring and oftentimes not very clear. You have to do a lot of studying on your own.

Lectures during class, no need to pay attention or participate. Only assignments are two 20 page papers (but he actually wants 30+pgs- he cares about length and # of citations not quality) and 1 debate (on paper topic). No need to read, but helps with papers. Class could be much better, but hes an old guy stuck in his ways

Locke is phenomenal. I took his Honors Philosophy class as a GE and loved it! Readings are short, and the class is almost completely discussion based after the first 2 weeks. You will LEARN how to write. If you go to office hours for your papers and learn from your mistakes, you will do well.

She is extremely disorganized; I cannot emphasize that enough. We had to cancel several reading assignments and essays because of her disorganization, and she gave very little instruction as to how we should approach the essays and presentations. She is helpful if you can meet with her, but her hours are unpredictable. Nice lady, ineffective prof

A provocative professor who doens't act like a professor. Nadon adopts whatever the view of the book he assigns and never gives his own views. Strange and sometimes frustrating. But he will make you reconsider your own opinions.

Appel is great - one of the best profs I've had at CMC. The material is intersting, the class is rigorous and challenging, yet very rewarding. She is undeniably knowledgable and very intelligent. Her class is clearly structured and always informative.
Martinez is super cool and super sweet. Homework is easy...tests are exactly like her practice tests. GO TO CLASS if you skip she will notice!

Professor Rosett is very funny.  He does his best to enertain in a class like accounting which generally isnt very enertaining.  The quizzes are really tough unless you are committed to learning the details that are covered in the book.  The accounting concepts are not difficult and they are important for upper level accounting classes.

Great math professor, only problem is that he is rather hard.  He makes you learn the material by testing the hell out of you but is VERY willing to help and is GREAT in office hours.  Take O'Neill if you really want to learn the subject and are willing to attend his office hours (important!)
Professor Velji is a great professor who challenged me so much in class and helped me so much outside of it. I would really recommend him!

Senor Carlos is one of the best professors/ teachers I've ever had. He allows you to joke around in class, and have fun. His tests aren't hard at all, and as long as you've had a little bit of spanish before you'll be alright.
She explains things in a very clear manner and has funny stories to share in class.  Also helpful outside of class.  Tests are a bit hard but i still got an A, just do the homework!
This Professor won't actually listen to what you are saying. He'll want to control your decisions and will not respect your opinion. Do not take him.

All she wants to talk about are her research articles. That is NOT intro to psych dude! I needed intro to psych since I am a psych major and I learnt nothing in her class. She does not even give extra credit. Tough grader, tough tests. Run dude, run!

It is true that Professor Broussard only teaches off of power point, but I don't think that was a hindrance to the class. She holds office hours twice a week and really encourages students to come in. She is funny and engaging and I thought she was a good teacher overall.

Kreines is a good professor but not 10/10(!!!!!!!!).  Discussions are good & well-led.  Office hours can be a little confusing.  His brain moves much faster than most, so it can be hard to follow what he's saying in office hours.

I made an account on ratemyprofs just to give him a good review. He is truly an incredible person, brilliant and so very kind. He knows so much about the topic and ties in all sorts of contemporary cases in hip hop with much greater analysis of neoliberalism, feminism, etc. He makes an effort to be approachable and is very engaging. Stellar, 10/10

Prof Koch has been my favorite prof I've had in college. She's so incredibly smart and passionate, but so willing to break down concepts for the class. She tends to structure her class mainly around class discussion, but when she lectures it's still amazing. Approachable & accessible during office hours and very clear about grading criteria

She's a nice person, but was largely unavailable for extra help when needed. Tests are not easy, although the problems are given in class, she doesn't give partial credit, so you can't make ANY errors or you will get a zero on the problem.

Dr. B is a great professor. Her lectures are engaging and she will really push you to think in new ways. Pretty tough grading on papers and a lot of dense reading, but the content is interesting and very applicable to everyday life. She is also very approachable and willing to help you during office hours.

Prof Fortner's classes were always so enjoyable -- he's really friendly with all of his students and jokes around a lot, but still manages to run class seriously. Very discussion and reading heavy but the class is more about discussing politics and questioning your own beliefs than learning the specifics of U.S. government.

Wright has a "cult following" status among CMCers. They have good reason for this -  he is a hidden gem of CMC. Despite his reputation, he's a great talker. Even though his teaching style and tests might make the class difficult, Wright is helpful in office hours & is willing to give out good grades despite a hard, but hilarious, class.

very knowledgeable. he assigns a lot of reading and he relies greatly on class participation, but will rarely call on students who don't volunteer. he may seem pompous at first, but warms-up through the semester. overall, if you pay attention you'll learn a lot.

The worst prof that I have had at CMC so far. Test and practice questions are completely different. Chooses grades based upon his own views of arguments, and will refuse to agree with other students' views in class even when his is clearly the weaker point. If you are stuck taking him, make sure you write about only what he wants to hear.
You should not take this class! This is the worst econ professor I have ever had!
Puts the material in your lap for you. Understand the graphs during class and the practice tests inside and out and there is no way you can not pull a B+ or higher.
good course

Had her for cognitive psych.  awesome class.  awesome prof.  easy grader.  very interesting lectures.  there are a lot of projects and you have to do all the text reading to do well on tests, but most people get As.  not bad for a GE

Very sweet and absolutely brilliant. Focuses a lot on women and motherhood because that was her research/book focus. Her grades are pretty up in the air and range significantly even though your writing doesn't. Give her exactly what she wants.

Professor Burdekin is a very good professor. His lectures are very interesting. He is very clear and knowledgeable. He is very accessible outside of class, willing to meet outside of office hours, and is very responsive to questions over email. Exams based on class material. If you go to every class and take good notes you will succeed.

Prof Ferree was awesome. He is the nicest guy ever and is always willing to help no matter what. Hes never condescending and is very easily approachable unlike many other science profs Ive had. He has take home exams that are challenging, but as long as you've put a lot of thought and details into them, you should be good. Take good lecture notes!

super nice prof, holds tons of office hours and increases availability before exams; organized, but sometimes he loses track of time; make sure you go over the slides THOROUGHLY esp if u haven't taken econ before bc it can get tricky, but put in the work (aka GO TO OFFICE HRS) and he will notice it; also offers LOTS of resources before each exam

Raviv is great. He has been one of my favorite professors here. He tells you the first day, if you are willing to work hard in this class, then you will do well. It's true. He's very friendly and helpful. I recommend!
Nichols is the best civ prof period
He is very passionate about his field. I strongly recommend this class.
She has some unusual views on things, but she is a very good teacher and she looks amazing every day in class.
If you like econ, he's not a bad intro class.  He doesn't care a whole lot about the class, but you do learn your stuff.

Dr. Sterling's main strength is that she is very easy to relate to. She makes her lectures interesting and relevant, and keeps the class organized. She's also very receptive to student feedback and understanding of what it is like to be a college student.

Professor Finley did a great job converting his ECON086 class into the virtual pandemic environment. His course is the most organized virtual course at CMC I've seen, and he is very accessible to help students. If you put in the time and effort, he will work with you.
Nichols may be a goofy bald man, but between the giggles and the chin rubbing, this might have been the most i've learned in any class.  interesting stuff too.

He's okay. Lot's of works covered. He lulls you into complacency by spending too much time on the Republic and then expects you to read over 30 chapters of Hobbes' Leviathan in a week later in the semester.
Her class is easy, but that's about all it's got going for it.  Her lectures are right out of the book, and not very informative.  Nice lady, though.
Professor Dershem is a great physics lab professor! He goes in great detail of physics concepts and helps you for the physics lab practical! Highly recommend- very chill person
You learn a lot about the happenings around you as well as whatever he covers from the textbook. Would take him again...

She is soooooo nice and will do anything to help you do well.  The class is pretty easy.  Tests come right out of your notes, there are no surprises.  She is really into the subject and gets very excited about everything.

I am a international student and a freshman. I definitely recommend his class. He knows how to teach and how to teach wisely about writing. More than that, I love him because he is such a knowledgable,  "mysterious" man. He is really a writer, thinker. He is so much like Kafka. Take his class and You will be amazed by literature!!!

Love Professor Rentz! Such a sweet, caring professor. Very willing to meet you during office hours and accommodate you during the semester. A hard grader on the essays, but very generous with the rest of the assignments. Decent workload and is very manageable. Love the reading material and make class discussions very inclusive.

love prof kim! there are super short daily quizzes due before class, workbook homework like once every 2 weeks, and a couple other short activites throughout the semester. if you attend office hours if confused, come to class having done the daily quiz, pay attention in class, and review her power points before tests, korean 1+2 wont be bad at all
I really enjoyed this class.  He makes things fun and rarely boring.  There is quite a lot of hw but it really helps to improve spanish skills especially with reading and writing.
I absolutely loved taking French with Professor Aitel. She is funny, nice, understanding, and easy. She is so good that I took 33 and 44 with her. I highly recommend taking a class from her!

Professor Gould is straight up, 100%, the most amazing professor/teacher I have ever had. If you do not take his class you are missing out! After 3 classes from him and have gone from needing office hours everyday, to being able to do any homework problem on my own. His classes are difficult but he is there to help every step of of the way.

He's a very nice guy, its ok if you don't do the reading...he doesn't call on people. You have to do a presentation on a book for the whole period which can be a pretty big task but he grades fairly. Never gets upset and has a great sense of humor!

Always willing to help.  Wants you to succeed.  Oh how she loves when ladies are in her class, she'll try to make ladies into math majors.  Very spirited, enthusiastic, don't let the final screw you though.  The final is definately everything, no notecard.

Professor O's Honours Intro class will make or break you as a philosopher. It is a difficult semester, but at the end of it, you will know whether or not philosophy is your subject. She loves bonding with her students, and if you play your cards right, she may sheepishly tell you about her boyfriend(s).

If you are willing to come to class and be present in class, meaning take notes of EVERYTHING he says, every example/scenario, and ask questions as they come up, you will do well. No homework, 3 non-cumulative tests, and 1 presentation. He responds to emails about practice problems within 10-30 minutes even on weekends. Kind, knowledgeable, caring.
Very clear presentation notes.  Worksheets and homework were good preparation for tests.  Not a lot of busy work and very willing to help students during office hours.

A very organized professor who makes himself available for his students. Problem sets help you understand the material. Although, the book is not as useful, if you listen in class and do the homework, you will do well.

Prof Sam is a great guy but his Calc II class is a lot harder than these ratings would have you believe.  HW and Quizzes were fine but exams were hard - mostly because you run out of time due to tedious algebra.  Sam also likes to give really easy example problems (like integrate x^2) and really difficult test problems, not cool.

Professor Lobis is delightfully sassy and articulate (his speaking is more precise than most writing). You do need to participate, but he's very forgiving if you make dumb comments during discussion. Moderately tough grader for papers imo, non-literature majors may have a tough time. Don't take Brit lit for a GE, take Shakespeare or Milton with him

He's very clear and his book is a perfect complement to the class (helps make sense of notes!).  He's a nice guy and uses examples that are helpful and often interesting.  He wants the students to do well, and it shows.

I didn't take any AP science classes in high school, and was actually pretty rusty in science, but I still managed to get a good grade in her class. Her lectures and drawings are based completely off the book, so if you don't get anything, you always have a literary reference. I was honestly never confused. She's very chipper, even at 8AM.
He's very hard to understand, probably because of his accent. The class material is very interesting though.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE PROFESSOR CODY! Even if she was teaching a class over a subject I absolutely hated, like math, I would still take the class just to have her as my professor. I had a paper I didn't do well on and met with her in office hours and she is letting me rewrite it and work with her. She is the nicest professor and definitely recommend!
Awful. Absolutely terrible. Avoid this professor if you ever want to understand what you're supposed to learn and get a half-decent grade. Do yourself a favor.

Haley classes are tough, he demands a lot from his students.  However, his classes are quite rewarding and they are at a level advanced courses should be tought at.  Great reading materiel, enthralling seminars, challenging research--you will learn fundamentals of political prudent leadership, how to argue, how to present and how to write.
Great great professor! Really approachable and the materials are informative and easy to follow.

lectures are so clear & comprehensive that you don't need to read; just GO TO CLASS & take good notes. not an easy grader. knows a TON. open to student opinions but not much discussion - more focus on history of phil than student discussion. good class.

I LOVE this guy. He somehow gets everyone to comfortably participate every class. Class is TOPICAL! We reference modern issues and connect it to the texts, which themselves are solid reads. He is a sweet, hilarious jolly man. Easy to talk to, you'll find that you spend more time than you think chatting with him! You just have to take his class!!

Massoud cares, the kind of prof that made CMC famous. He is focused on teaching and you can call him on weekends. Do not expect to cake walk through this class. Every CMCer needs to take  a Massoud class before you graduate. ECON 86 is an awesome class.

5 Exams worth 10% each, 2 four page papers worth 15% each and 5 reading responses. If he doesn't agree with your argument be ready to expect a B. But otherwise amazing professor, loved his teaching style specially his examples. He is very chill and also always willing to help outside of class.
um, take two steps back, amir ... way more touchy and flirty than any professor should be, in my opinion ...

If you're looking to get an easy A GE out of the way, intro psych with reed is the way to go. The class is really easy, but she is an awful teacher that teaches down the material so much so that going to her class is an annoyance. She means well, but her class is a glorified daycare full of powerpoint heavy lecture and condescendingly slow pacing.

Professor Busch always seems to be in a good mood and because of this gives interesting lectures.  Very easy to pay attention in his class.  Really hard to get an A, but an A- or B+ is completely feasible if you put the work in.

Professor Locke is an EXCELLENT professor - one of the best I've had at CMC. His classes are certainly difficult but worthwhile. He grades you hard throughout the semester to push you, but his final grades are very generous. If you actually want to learn something and improve, take his class.

He goes out of his way to make the subject interesting and make himself available outside of class. You really have to work for an A, but when you do, you learn a lot. He'll make you a better reader/writer. His feedback is sometimes longer than your entire essay, and it's because he truly cares about helping his students learn.
she was quirky, and somewhat entertaining, but took a subject that I'm normally good at and between her and the book, made it much more difficult than it actually is.
Helpful, but one of the hardest classes I've ever taken and assigns ridiculous amounts of work.

I learned a lot from Prof Wang; she is extremely knowledgeable about what she teaches. As an intro course, the grading was pretty formulaic. If you do the reading, you can easily do well. Her lectures were very informative and interesting enough to keep me engaged. She always came off as nervous when lecturing, but I think that's just how she is.

Professor Warner is a captivating lecturer, very clear about the class and requirements, and really  makes it hard NOT to see him outside of class to help with your writing. He is indeed a tough grader but it's reasonably fair since he is upfront about raising the bar.

THE best econ prof at CMC! Don't be turned away by the difficulty of the class, you will learn a huge amount in his class. Massoud is the most caring and nice professor in the world, and he will work very hard to help you succeed. If you get a bad grade it's your own damn fault.

By far the most overrated prof at CMC.  Pitney is all vague talk.  He didn't actually teach gov, we just discussed books.  He's actually pretty easy because he only gives B's on papers, even after telling us 500 times how he will mark our papers to hell.People just say he's great because it's trendy

It's an interesting class however slightly unpredictable, his exams are usually much harder than practice exams. Though he grades blind (and fair). There is no way to guarantee a good grade in this class, just try to understand everything
Prof. Cody is the absolute best. I have never had a more caring and passionate professor. She will do anything for her kids and knows her subject in mind-boggling detail.

Extremely difficult if you don't come prepared, but completely worth it in the end. She will make you work for the grade, but she's a phenomenal professor who will make you a better student guaranteed. Speaking in class is mandatory, which pays off in the end (even if you don't like to be put on the spot).

This class does not improve your writing at all. I learned more in my 45 minute sessions at the writing center than I learned in his class all semester. He's a boring teacher and unhelpful at his office hours.
Amazing professor! Amazing course! I learned so much from the text. If you wish to learn about the Western traditions, especially Judaism and Christianity, take Professor Gilbert's courses!

This man is the hardest and best professor I've had so far.  He will make you work more than you've ever worked before, but he makes it worth your while and fascinating. As long as you're not scared of shouldering a burden and getting the most of your college education, take a class with him, it's worth it.
Really smart, very helpful. Loved the class!!!

I really enjoyed Professor Favretto's class. It was not very difficult but the content was interesting. The class was lecture-heavy and your grade depends on only two tests and one paper. An A is definitely attainable.

Very nice man. Writes amazing recommendations, so get to know him. Intro level gov class- His lectures could be boring at times, but hes clearly interested in the subject matter.  Participate for the debates and do the readings for the daily quizzes. An A is not impossible.
He rocks

He requires a lot of writing (4 papers with a 10-15 page final paper and an exam) He is not helpful. He doesn't check his e-mail and he isn't very prepared for class. His grading scale makes absolutely no sense. For an instutution that prides itself on quality, he is most definitely a weakness.

Not sure about the good reviews below. Riggio was okay, a very average professor that I wouldn't mind taking again for a class I don't care for, but not a professor I would take again if I had another option. Boring class overall but it wasn't the hardest thing.

A great teacher. The class is hard though, although the bad grade was largely my fault. She holds really fun labs that make it interesting for a non-science major, unlike pretty much all the other science courses you can take here. And they're usually short--another plus.
He's a terrific professor if you're willing to learn the material. Doesn't use the book much and is super enthusiastic in class. Whether you enjoy the course or not, it's hard not to like him

She teaches ONLY from PowerPoint slides, which is incredibly frustrating. She doesn't explain how to do problems, so the tests are kind of shocking- you feel like the questions have come from nowhere.  She is very nice, just not my best teacher.

I understand why Leland has gotten average ratings, as he is a very difficult grader and expects a lot from his students. However, as a Lit major, he has inspired me to be a better writer and look for art in everything I see; what more can you ask of a professor?
I used to love CS. Now I dread the subject. Homeworks take forever and he doesn't understand that we have a life outside of his class. His exams test you to see if you can be a compiler. Useless.
Very interesting course. Great person. Not lots of work, but lots of thinking. I learned a lot.
