Class was entirely discussion based.  Assigned absurd amounts of reading.  Impossible to get a decent grade on essays - even if you show him your essay beforehand and do everything he tells you to do, you'll get a mediocre grade at best.  Avoid at all costs.

On the one hand, the final project for this class was the most work I've ever done for a homework assignment, and took more time than some of the other entire classes I've taken. On the other hand, I told him I was going through a rough patch and he gave me an extension to the end of the semester no questions asked. Would recommend.
Unbelievable professor. Makes class a lot of fun and is an interesting professor. Not too bad looking either-and he likes the Dodgers

I often felt as though he was trying to be openminded, but was just failing at it.  It becomes clear eventually that he's a pretty conservative Christian and that just biases him too much.  He is pretty nice, though.

Prof Kreines is amazinghe has a real commitment to make the classroom environment and his pedagogy as inclusive as possible, and does his best to simplify the complex concepts that are part of his class. He has gone above and beyond his duties as a professor, even sending me additional readings outside of class that connect to my discussion posts.

The class is GREAT, the professor so-so. His reviews all remarked how preferential he is towards males, which is tough in a participation-heavy class, and we struggled with his lack of clarity of assignments (and making 60% of our grade due the week after thesis!). That being said, the class is AMAZING, one of the very best, just be prepared!

Take a class with Prof Gilbert!! He is insanely knowledgable and very unbiased in his teaching. This is honestly one of the best classes I've taken in college. Clear expectations, reasonable but not easy grading, gives extensions if needed. Lots of reading but don't need to do most, take good class notes though and don't miss class. Learned SO much

Personally I enjoyed her class. She was really helpful outside of class and would always go the extra way to help you understand a concept you didn't understand. Plus there's tons on extra credit literally like 10% of your final grade because she accepts tests corrections for partial credit. I would take her again.
Awesome. Take her class. She is very smart but also fun and loves her students. She brought us pizza multiple times. I want to take another philosophy class because of her.

I'm not a lit major but I've taken several lit courses bc of Meyer.  Despite what other negative comments there might be, give her a chance.  She doesn't demand much of you and she usually only assigns short essays.  She gets incredibly excited about the topics and (if you try some) you'll get excited too.  She's brilliant and awesome!
I loved this class and Norman so much! Participation is super easy and the workload is super manageable making it a really fun class.

There's a fine line between "it's part of the culture" and inappropriate; the last time Gonzales saw that line, he was still living in Peru. Any time work by a female poet is read, Gonzalez lectures on how mysterious/delicate women are, and how they truly have all the power. Otherwise, he speaks mostly English in class and grades arbitrarily.

Pears is the perfect Gov professor to take if you are an international student or don't know anything about American Politics. Her classes are mostly lecture and discussion based, but will sometimes throw in a cool activity. She is a normal grader- leaning more towards tough than lenient. There is a lot of reading so be prepared for that.
Yes, he allows notecards, but doesn't really teach the material. Does too many problems on the board during class for my taste.

She has one of the largest cult followings at CMC. She's a hard grader. Her office hours are jampacked.  That said, she's incredibly, incredibly nice and down to earth. Go chat with her just for fun (if there's not a huge line).

Class was awesome!  I loved it. We went in depth about topics (NOT wars and stuff).. why war crimes? does army change you? recruitment?  great topics.  There is a lot of reading because you NEED to talk as this is a seminar.  1, 5 page paper a week too!  so it's a lot of work and you need to participate. harder than i thought

Very interesting class from which I learned a lot especially because I didn't have an Econ background. Olfati is funny and makes the material as interesting as possible but it is Econ and you can expect a few long boring problem sets in lectures. Very difficult to get an A because she insists only 95%+ receive A's and not 93%+. Quizzes are a breeze

Professor O's class literarily is the class that makes me fall in love with philosophy. She is very helpful and engaging. The structure of the lecture is extremely clear. The workload is much lighter than I expected. The average reading volume is about only ten pages. But it is true that you need to pay a lot of attention to it. TAKE HER CLASS!

Johny is a Greek God. He convinced me to take a history dual with my major. He is by far the most helpful prof at CMC if you visit his office hours (He's always available) and will help you with outside-class stuff too.   LOTS of reading though. 200 pages a week for my class. But totally worth it.
No Comments

If you aren't looking forward to taking Civ, take nichols. He doesn't hold you responsible for the reading and he is an easy grader. The assessments are reasonable and infrequent. The class is pretty boring, but it is important to go. Just regurgitate the lectures in your papers with a little extra insight and you'll do really well.

Nadon is either the worst professor you've ever taken or the best -- I tend to err on the latter side, but I could see how one could find him offensive. Personally, I thought he challenged me on my own beliefs and helped me gain a better understanding of political society. In my opinion, he's thought-provoking, but he's not everyone's cup of tea

Professor Hurlocker was one of my favorite professors. I took both semesters of Intro Chem with her and they definitely required hard work but she was organized and did a good job going through material. Her office hours are amazing, she is so sweet, really knows how to explain specific concepts to you, and will work with you until you understand.

Nice guy, but gets lost easily, often creates too tricky examples that even he can't work through. Homework can be on subjects not covered properly in class and at a level that has not been explained. Tests are not bad though. Out of 19 or so at the beginning less than half remained...
Bowman gave few tests his lectures were long. Group project lasted whole year. it was tedious, unclear grading. only took for major req.

She's so mean! Racicot is not friendly or helpful in or outside of class. She contradicts herself all the time, and her grading isn't clear. She is vague, and seems really unconfident in her field. All this combined with her poor attitude doesn't make for a very good experience.

She is pretty lecture heavy, but the content was interesting and she keeps the class engaged with plenty of time to ask questions if you're confused. The problem sets could be tricky sometimes, but she's willing to help if you ask.

Though not as prominent academically as some other religious studies teachers at CMC, Michon's passion and knowledge of the coursework made every class interesting and engaging. Was clear, open and honest in expectations from students and a fair, committed grader. Definitely take a Michon class for engaging discussions and a personalized experience
Most talented history professor at CMC and nicest person on campus

JUST TAKE HIM! If you can't - wait to take the class until you can. The man is amazing. He is really helpful and personable. Teaches with the mentality of "ask questions, it helps the team, we are a team." Office hours & Reviews are great. He definitly thinks of us as his children. He always smiles!

Prof. Fernholz just reads off the slides which you have access to on Sakai so you don't really have to show up. The course is test heavy and he doesn't curve so your overall grade is the averages of your tests, basically. Although, he is helpful during office hours and cares about his students.

I love this man!  Professor Camp is genuinely one of the nicest professors I've ever met, and truly wants students to learn.  His class is interesting and very pertinent.  He even has the class over to his house-- twice!  Basically he is amazing.

Everyday: "This is kind of Econ101 stuff that you all won't understand, but I'm going to say it anyway..."  and he was right...we didn't understand.  I learned a lot ONLY because I went out and learned it ON MY OWN...

The lectures can get a little boring but otherwise the class and prof Gelman are great! Tests are not that hard and they don't make up a lot of your grade. Group projects influence your grade a lot so make sure you're ok with that.

great prof who isn't here to fail you. extremely generous when it comes to making sure our tests are fair and he's rly funny. would ABSOLUTELY recommend him if you've taken calc before; but even if you haven't, if you pay attention you'll do fine. he'd be great for a higher level math class if he decides to teach one
Awesome professor -- fun class -- you'll learn a lot without doing too much busywork
Easy tests, very sarcastic and entertaining, makes fun of students, fair grader

Professor Finseth is an amazing professor who is caring and considers DEI in STEM. She is very lecture heavy, but her lectures are very clear and concise as long as you listen and come to class. The tests are somewhat tricky but very doable; plus, she will give you opportunities to have some help during exams!

He is a really nice man. Generally not the hardest class but it was often confusing as to what was expected. The class was a large lecture and sometimes it was hard to determine what was actually important to take notes on. He is what I see as the stereotypical college professor. Often the textbook was too hard / too in-depth and was not helpful.

This was a bad class. Prof. is very defensive and at times hostile, rejecting students ideas that don't line up w/ her own narrow, feminist, anti-male perspective. Grading policies are subjective and unfair. Don't touch w/ a ten-foot pole. (I want a refund.)
Tough****.  Hard to understand him.  Explains concepts as if you're on his level.  He's too smart.
I don't know about her bad side, but I found her to be really passionate about the subject which was refreshing.  She was nice and seemed to be willing to accept different interpretations.
Pitney is a great professor. He makes you work, but it's so worth it.
No Comments
he is so nice!

Prof. Bird is thorough and tough, but he knows his stuff and will teach you well.  His lectures are far from boring, which is saying something when it comes to Global Finance (dull).  He won't let you get away with weak answers, but if you care about Econ, you will learn a lot from him, and I love his self deprecating humor

DO NOT TAKE. I MEAN IT. Do not take biology with this lady. You will learn nothing. She knows her shtuff, it is obvious, but doesn't speak clear English. Her class is poorly organized. Just reconsider. Try Sadava or something.
the worst prof I ve had at cmc

How can you fully engage in this absurdly boring class. Don't read the books - he goes over everything 10 different ways in class. Take good notes and you'll ace the test and papers... but it'll be hard to keep the drool off them. Work load is not too bad... two tests, two papers.
Very passionate and knowledgable.

Raviv is a great teacher. He is willing to go over any concepts or work you don't understand. His homework can be difficult but that is help you learn and prepare you for tests. He was also a great teacher for Game Theory.

Prof. Kesler is a very helpful and nice guy. Very approachable to students and don't make you stupid or intimidated to talk to him and ask him questions. There's not too much discussions going on in his class, but his lectures are really enlightening. Not too much workload either! Good for a non gov major student to take gov 20 with!

Loves to teach and can be engaging because of it. But his class is poorly organized. Very easy. Lots of films of live performances. Mandatory attendance at 3 jazz concerts. Papers are generally reaction papers.

Didn't take her own subject too seriously, made the workload easy to handle, gave quizzes instead of homework, very clear about what was expected, tests were fair, she's quite funny during lecture. Doesn't really inspire you to want to take econ unless you're already headed that way, so good for STEM majors just looking to fulfil a GE.

Don't think online was Terril's forte. He's nice but a bit bumbling. Disorganized with time lines (which was tough in a journalism class where deadlines are usually emphasized). Tries to help: good feedback on papers (not very timely though) and flexible with circumstances. Great intro to journalism; don't be intimated if you have no experience.

He is easily the worst teacher I have ever had. There is absolutely no structure to his 'lectures' and he often either loses his train of though or ventures down unnecessary and irrelevant tangents. Furthermore, his 'study guides' are pitiful and are of no help in preparing for exams. There is no upside to taking this class.

Bad for a GE but great if you actually want to get to know the material. He is a very difficult test grader but it's only because he wants you to truly appreciate what is being taught. Very helpful in and out of class and definitely willing to help if your grades have fallen in a hole.
Nice guy, lectures straight off power points and out of the book. Fine for an Econ 50 teacher. He tries to adapt to fit some of the needs of the students.

DO NOT GET ON HER BAD SIDE.
 again: 
 DO NOT GET ON HER BAD SIDE.
hard as a rock, but a boss nonetheless.  hilarious dude, hilarious

Professor Rose is a great professor. Her lectures are very clear and conversation based. As with any GOV 020 class, there is a fair bit of reading, but she does her best to male sure we understand and analyze it. Great intro gov professor.

Very very good lecturer.  A lot of the quality of the class depends on the participants, he likes to do discussion, but a lot relies on what students have read (if they have) he assigns a good amount of reading, fortunetely it's usually interesting.

Although at first he built up a lot of excitement about the course, his lectures became very dry and useless to go to. He gave a pop "quiz" every now and then for attendance purposes, but you could get away with not going a few times. He is an incredibly nice and knowledgeable guy when you meet with him, but it is hard to stay alert in lectures.

Prof. Martinez is the worst professor that I have had during my time at CMC and sent me into an existential crisis on multiple occasions. She taught less than half of the class (electing to call the CWPD consultant or guest speakers to talk to us or just playing a video). She does not teach and does not even understand her own schedule.

Professor Altamirano is really nice and class is always engaging. We do a lot of fun activities and have many interesting conversations. She is a lenient grader and her tests are fair. She wants students to do well and she is good at breaking down grammar rules to help us learn them better.
She takes the textbook and puts it on the board. Unforgiving, unhelpful and uninteresting.
laughs at all his own jokes!
Organic Chemistry is never easy but she made it manageable. She is really easy to talk to and made me want to come to class.

Prof Gonzales is the sweetest man ever and really builds a genuine connection with all of his students and wants them to succeed. His homework is super manageable and class is fun and there's nothing to stress about.

One of the best professors at CMC! He is one of the most clear lecturers and relays the information very thoroughly. Easily accessible outside of class through office hours and emails. Each test and quiz are fair to the content.

Nita Kumar is by far the worst professor I have ever taken at CMC. She is opinionated and biased, she spends most of the class time trying to convince us to believe her conspiracy theories without any form of reasonable proof. Unless you enjoy getting frustrated by bias opinionated teachers, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASSES.

Professor Pei is so awesome. He is very clear and an excellent teacher. He has tons of expertise on everything he teaches. I would recommend 10000000%! He is great for Comp Gov, East Asian Political Economy and Chinese Politics.

Stanton is a nice lady - she is willing to help if you ask and come to office hours, and she has her problem solving sessions which are very helpful for the exams. However, she can go very quickly in her lectures and I had to watch supplementary videos just to catch up to the material. Study the practice exam!!

Hatcher Skeers is a very good teacher. Although the tests are tough, if you do the assigned readings and assignments, it isn't that bad.  Your grade defenetly reflects how much work you put into the class.

Extremely helpful professor. Go talk to him during office hours, it will be worth the time. It's easy to get a B+, but you'll have to work for an A. He is also very chill and friendly. I like to just go talk about the movie that I watched over the weekend.

Most amazing professor I have ever had. She is extremely helpful and will do anything she can to help you understand the material. She is very open minded in class discussions and the material is extremely interesting. If you have a chance to take a class with her, DO IT!
Wonderful class, great books and the topics made me question and think about the subject matter.
An amazing professor with a real passion for the subject. Very funny and innovative in teaching techniques. WWI "helmet day" rocked!

Takes a little while to get used to and his lectures can be boring (as are the textbooks) BUT not a bad guy, doesn't grade too hard if you put in a little effort, if you are a history major then take him.

Professor Antill was a great FHS teacher. Class was Faith and Reason and he really knew how to analyze religious arguments. Class was very thought provoking and interesting. No textbook only online readings too! Only criticism is he grades papers pretty tough and they are 90% of your grade and his grading scale isn't totally clear.
Very good professor. He will make sure you understand the texts to the core. If you're not interested in government, don't take his class, as I imagine it would get very boring.

My advisor and one of my favorite professors at CMC.  Sometimes his lectures are boring, but try and listen because he has great things to say.  All the reading was interesting.  I basically love this man. ,
No Comments
Took Professor Grant's class for Micro and loved it. Very math heavy but she explains it very well. Tests can be slightly challenging but are extremely fair. 10/10 would recommend this class

Fernholz is the boss. His teaching method is fairly consistent with the book he uses and tries to teach everything in context to the real world. He keeps the math simple which has its drawbacks but makes the class fairly easy.

Professor Obdrzalek is helpful and entertaining.  She has high standards for her students. In order to receive an "A" in the class, students should take their papers to her during office hours to get her feedback.  Her expectations are high but they are clear.  Without question, she goes above beyond the requirements of her job.

Professor Coleman is a wonderful professor, and makes the class extremely fun and interesting. The tests were also interesting though. They always felt really easy, but it did seem like she would take off points just to get you down to a certain grade. It was almost like your grade was predetermined. Besides for that, great class and fun professor

He seems really hard but once you get used to his style of teaching, you learn sooo much. At times he is unintentionally intimidating but hes a nice guy really. He really knows his stuff and teaches Econ in a way it makes us think unlike other Econ teachers who use no math and just expect you to puke out defntions on the test. Best forthe long run
This professor is very understanding about absences if you keep in touch with him constantly through email. Stay on top of the essays and you will be fine.

Biochemistry joint-taught between Dr. Wenzel and Dr. Tang. Her lectures are incomprehensible. Hard to follow & unorganized. It's sad because she is SO PASSIONATE about Bio and is BRILLIANT. Knows her stuff. She cares so much about her students but I'm sorry to say, her effectiveness in teaching/explaining is too low to be helpful.

My favorite class in college so far! Class was entirely based on discussion, so be ready to have an opinion. She graded papers pretty hard, not impossible to get an A if you work. Helped me understand the modern politics and basic contemporary american history as well as teaching me to form my own opinion of historical events. very enlightening!

We had to play this ridiculous and grueling role-playing history game to pass this class, which pretty much sums it up. Just skip this professor. As stated, grading is very arbitrary. Do not take unless history major and are very very committed to the field. Strange college class, but CMC is very strange.

I took Org. Health Care/Public Policy with Prof Lynch which was one of my favorite courses by far at CMC. Amazing guest speakers, fun class lectures, interesting discussion videos and open-minded discussions. Reasonable homework, only two papers throughout the course with clear grading criteria. Take this class and you won't regret it!

Prof. Raviv teaches game theory very abstractly, and you are forced to learn the material through extremely difficult problem sets and past midterms that don't accurately affect the upcoming ones. The grade breakdown was: 20% problem sets (5), 20% midterm 1, 20% midterm 2, 40% final. This was not good, considering the raw average on mid2 was a 58%.
If you're doing well in the class, she will make the final 6.023 x 10^23 times harder and ruin your life. Just because she can.

Long, droning lectures are a bit difficult to get through, but you have GOT to go to class to do well in this class. The testing method - identifying and explaining passages - is a little weird and gets REALLY hard on the final, when you have 7 or 8 authors to choose from. Still, learned a lot and he will help you out if you ask for it.

Professor Mackey's could be a little clearer in lecture. Often he gives a lot of examples but doesn't really explain the grand scheme of things. He's got a good sense of humor though and is very helpful outside of class. His tests are fair, but a lot of learning is done outside of class, as is expected with Organic Chemistry.

Prof. Shelton is obviously so intelligent and passionate - that being said, she did not handle the transition to online learning that well. I feel for her, because her lecture style is really well suited to in-person instruction. I definitely learned a lot in this class, but I fell off towards the end in terms of motivation to stay engaged.

Econ 50 was a tough class, especially when it came to tests. However, Prof Evans was always very clear with her explanations and made herself very accessible outside of class (office hours). She is very nice and approachable. You have to work hard for a good grade but you definitely learn a lot.

Professor Meany is quite different from what his name suggests- he's one of the kindest, most nurturing professors I've encountered at CMC. His class required a lot of work, but his extensive feedback indubitably improved my skills involving professional communication. Amazing individual and extremely sharp professor.

Lecture Heavy, but he's an awesome lecturer.  Favorite Prof. at CMC so far.  He's funny and engaging in class and really cares about his students. It helps to have the textbook, since some test questions come from it, but tests are truly lecture-heavy. He's the best. TAKE THIS CLASS!!! :)

Didn't like his teaching style. Really liked the 5 quiz system. Didn't like the online portion of the class. Professor Rosett has an odd sense of humor that can be really amusing, but is also easily distracted from the course material. Most of the learning is self-study
cannot teach, boring
No Comments

Professor Shaar is super nice and really want to help you out. He is not the best at explaining topics in class but if you go to office hours everything is explained very well. The midterms are straight forward, they are not to difficult and you know exactly what material will be tested.

I had no real knowledge of accounting before this course. I got a good amount out of the material and am glad that I took this class. His class project was about 1/10th as long as professor Massoud's* project, so that was a plus. Sometimes there was material on the exams that we had not encountered before (in the long problems). Overall good course

I took Professor Pitney's class as a freshmen over 20 years ago. I had no interest at all in government at the time and have since become a doctor. However, he taught me so many things in that one class that I remember to this day.  Looking back at my college experience, he was the most inspiring professor I met! Thank you for the memories.

Professor Crockett is very caring and understanding, on top of being extremely helpful and passionate about helping her students learn and grow. She is a tough grader but she makes her expectations very clear and offers to give you feedback on drafts before submitting the final draft. Her feedback is very useful. Truly an amazing prof.

econ 180 is the seminar that goes with thesis. burdekin is the nicest guy in the world, and he's always willing to help. a lot of professors at cmc make you see them in person before they'll be helpful at all, but burdekin reads through e-mails and replies thoroughly. that's amazingly convenient and it shows how much he cares about his students!
Professor Grant really cares. She's tough, and I took 101 in a virtual capacity, but she was so accessible. The A is attainable, you just need to put in the work.

Prof Muravchik is one of the best teachers I've ever had. As someone with zero background in American politics, she was so understanding, and willing to lend her time to answer all questions. Not a good professor. He wants you to understand, but his teaching style isn't good. His midterms are hard and he doesn't curve the class, so no only is it hard, but its also tough to do well in.

Aimaq took a required GE and turned it into one of the most intellectually stimulating classes I have taken at the 5Cs. Intelligent. Seriously cares about her students. Fair grader and is very clear in terms of grading and expectations for her students. Super helpful during office hours! Really amazing professor. If you have a chance to take a class with him, do. Probably one of the best lecturers I've ever met, let alone at Keck.

Locke is a difficult professor but totally worth it. He is really dedicated to his students and really good in office hours. He expects a lot, but if you're interested in Philosophy he's awesome. Also, extremely clear when you see him during office hours.

He is absolutely crazy.  A very eccentric debate coach who will ramble on, literally for hours on any subject.  Amusing and interesting, he's a good coach, but when he gets into more advanced debate techniques he is almost unintelligible.

Literally my favorite class this semester. If you actually participate it can be hilarious, inspirational and awesome. Pretty good guy, but tough grader so just go meet with him. Would 100% take again.
Wonderful teacher!  Caring, super smart, and very helpful. She picks wonderful reading materials.
Best prof and class I've ever taken.  He requires concise writing, which is useful in non-academic settings.
Miller's a straightforward and reasonable professor. He's also really approachable during office hours. If you put in the effort and do some reading you'll do well. I'd recommend him for GOV20!

great professor. Probably the best I've had at CMC.  He has a very good reputation in his field, and completely deserves it.  Discuss case studies in class, making the learing very applicable.  He made class low stress and easy to participate with.
Great class!
Best sense of humor I've ever seen in a professor. Personalized essay prompts actually make writing essays fun!
He's awesome! So funny. Just a big happy man who doesn't stop smiling.

Prof Branch was new this semester & was amazing; he brings a younger teaching style & perspective that I felt I didn't get with other gov profs. Gilbert cares a lot about her students, and you can tell. But she seems pretty disorganized and wasn't very clear about what she expects from us (which makes the tests difficult). No homework, good professor, and clear grading criteria. Class is just hard because it is just midterms. Overall, glad I am taking it. He wants kids to do well, and makes some funny jokes. One downside: man has really bad hand writing. But, still good class and interesting stuff.

very nice and friendly guy! math has always been my least fav subject but he was super helpful in office hours. Wiley is a great teacher, incredibly enthusiastic, and someone you will want to do research with after her class. That being said, she is hard. Her tests employ applications of topics to completely new scenarios more than just regurgitations of information. Don't take her if you want to coast.

Prof Kanaya is hilarious and quirky (in a great way) - I will really miss classes with her. Classes are interactive and feel like a direct dialogue with her. Great teacher! In love with his subject, and wants to make all his students understand and like it too.

if you are interested in Western religions, you must take a course from Dr. Gilbert. He is the sweetest prof who really wants to teach you something. Go chat with him in office hours too, very approachable.

Great professor that deserves tenure. Obviously highly intelligent without being stuffy, I would highly recommend him.

Valenza is a wonderful, intelligent, brilliant professor, and manages to speak to students with a genuine warmth and thoughtfulness. I loved Civ10, it was one of the best experiences of my first year. Class very interesting. He extends a Thanksgiving invitation to everyone in his classes.
Taw is one of my favorite profs ever. She is extremely knowledgeable and loves what she does. Our group discussions were great. Reading is necessary but not too long. Highly recommended prof.
this class isn't even worth going to, i understand the book a thousand times better than i understand the lectures.

Chaucer. Took for a GE and it was actually a very enjoyable class. Loved Professor Rentz. She was a total sweetheart and was very helpful in office hours. wonderful teacher, loves her topics and will always help with any questions/concerns

Very fascinating professor. A great teacher who knows his stuff. Hard to get an A but easy to get a B/B+.

It IS lecture heavy but participation matters too! I loved Professor Lower's course on the Holocaust. I actually learned the most about a historical event I ever have. Very knowledgeable prof who is very willing to help students. Readings are interesting as are the issues discussed in class. WOuld recommend highly.

Considering it was her first year teaching, I think Professor Williams did a great job. Hurley is a truly amazing professor.  He clearly loves what he teaches, and he loves to help you understand it.  Incredibly helpful if you need it. Wright is right  :)

Professor Burdekin is a very intelligent and articulate teacher.  If you do not pay attention in class your notes are meaningless once you get around to them. Prof. Wall is a great professor if you already have previous knowledge of spanish 1.  She is very accessible and encourages people to come for extra help. Fabulous professor. She's extremely enthusiastic and cares a lot about her students. Its always fascinating when she talks about her research interests. Take her class!

Engaging lectures every class with some (not a lot) of students participation. I found the tests to be very difficult, but this was not a feeling shared by the whole class. Definitely have to put in the work, but you'll get something out of it.

Relatively innovative but chill grading system; no need to buy textbook; need to pay close attention to his lectures or you will find it hard to understand what's going on. Love her! She's the sweetest prof and you can tell that she loves what she teaches. Her FWS class "Making Monsters" is similar to a high school literature class, but with more focus on writing skills. There's a reading before every class, and you have to submit 400 words every week.

Professor Nelson is currently my favorite teacher CMC. He is extremely kind and helpful outside of class. he's kind of arrogant but if you go to class and deal with it you will do well. i didn't read anything but went to class and took good notes and pulled a B no problem

his classes are easy but boring

Congress is the best class at CMC.  Not only is Pitney a fun and good profossor, I highly recommend getting to know him outside of class.  He is an amazing and interesting person (with a lot of connections).  If you take a class with him- make Strunk and White you closest friend.

Bassam is the best professor to learn Arabic from. He really wants his students to learn Arabic and enjoy learning it. Being a difficult language, Arabic requires a lot of work outside of class, but it is truly worth it!

Does not go over the material in class, you have to read and take a reading quizzes before each class. He asks the class questions on the reading during class and gets irritated easily. I learned everything through tutors and re-reading the text book. One positive is that the exams are fairly short and easy.

Great classes. The class did sometimes feel like a book club meeting instead of a history class. If Yoo would take a more active role in leading the discussion, it would be an amazing class. Yoo's comments are always helpful, and he structures his assignments to make sure his students do well. I can't wait to take another class with in him.

VERY Strict about attendence!  If you want a slacker class, this is not it.  The reading isn't too bad, but she challenges you to extrapolate farther than every expected, with a reading paper required for almost every class.  Prof. O keeps it dynamic in the classroom, too, with some of the best discussions I have ever had in my academic life.
Tells jokes and makes you think.  Love his accent--he is from Italy.  He makes math fun, even though I am not good at it.
I found the class extremely interesting. Pitney has such knowledge on the subject. He also is extremely helpful in improving student writing, and will find any mistake.

Ok professor. Moves kind of fasts in lectures and does not always explain concepts clearly. Tests include problem types never seen before. Office hours are not super helpful. Good news is he uploads PPTs so you can review.
Great class, lot of movies.  The final and midterm are a breeze if you use the study guide.  There's some work involved, but not a huge time commitment.  Class is a lot of fun and fairly easy A.
One of the greatest philosophy/religion profs at the 5-C's - this is the man that got me interested in majoring in philosophy. Not that easy, but an EXCELLENT teacher.
No Comments

Prof is amazing. You can tell he is so passionate about his class and the subject he teaches which is awesome! The class is not content heavy and the exams were take home which was great. He may be picky grader at times but overall his grading is easier than most professor. It is hard to get into his class because he is a gem. Makes tome for you.

Professor Valenza is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. He cares so much about his students and tries to make calculus interesting for non-math majors. It is not hard to get an A if you listen in class and do the homework. I would highly recommend taking his Calc 1 class if you have the chance to fulfil the math GE.

Such a great prof!! So kind and very accessible and willing to help during office hours. She gave interesting lectures and I enjoyed the assignments. She appreciates participation in class and does a good job of guiding the discussion, which I loved! If you have the opportunity to take a class of hers, do it!!
this man is truly everything. one of the nicest people out there who actually cares and all that. he wants to see you succeed!!!!!!!!!
Amazing professor, extremely helpful, open and passionate.  She is by far the best history prof in the school!
Class is more conversation and literary analysis than grammar.Great class-much more interesting and rewarding than typical Spanish 33 and 44 classes!
Good for an intro class.  Tests are essay/short answer. Two "projects" during the semester.  He knows his stuff and is a great guy to be around.

Econ 196 was the best class I've taken at CMC. Even though the subject matter is extremely difficult, Professor Shelton takes them time to make sure everyone is on the same page. This is an excellent class that gives you the opportunity to understand growth, pricing, the business cycle, and unemployment at a much more advanced level than 102.

If you want to become a better writer, take Prof. Warner. His feedback can feel nit-picky, but it is always specific and helpful. He invests time in his students. Class was a mixture of lecture and discussion with some really great handouts.

Fantastic professor. Her class can certainly be daunting, but she also definitely means well. She is very friendly and willing to help. I have taken two classes with her so far and both have been very challenging but equally helpful. Study hard, ya shabab. You need to understand   what she's teaching in order to succeed. I recommend office hours.

Just avoid him. Lectures never make sense. Huge calculation on exams with unfair grading. He uses his body to cover the broad when he explains problems. The whole class are constantly confused and he is arrogant if you ask him too many questions. It's a pity that a liberal art college has class like that.

I definitely recommend taking Aseema's GOVT060 class! She is a sweet and bright lady. She is always willing to help and she never forces you to participate in class, though she has room for class participation (i.e. its not all lecture). Her tests are not hard - she focuses on important concepts not trivial details.

I actually really liked this class and I think he genuinely made me a smarter person. The workload isn't bad- you write a one page paper each class but it's usually just a reflection and he doesn't want you to take more than 30 mins on it. Plus 3-4 major papers. Taught me a lot. And go to class to discuss or else you won't get participation points!

I don't know why Prof. Uvin has low reviews for his freshman seminar courses, but in his area of interest, he's amazing. Funny, knowledgeable, and super accessible -- I'd definitely take another class with him, because I learned a lot and enjoyed it the whole way through.

In class professor Massoud is great! He clearly understands the material and explains it well, but when it comes to test he can be unfair. There will be aspects to questions that would have not been addressed. Also, MAKE SURE TO GET OLD TESTS! He midterms and final are from prior years.

She's pretty terrible. Assigned at least 50 pages of reading in the textbook each week. Doesn't curve her tests, even though everyone failed the second one. Exams are extremely difficult and she likes to pick random buried facts from the text and test you on them. Avoid at all costs.

Awesome experience, loves his subject, and it shows!He teaches you how to critically think, instead of sheer memorization.  Learn the concepts and you'll do well on the tests...that's it, plain and simple.  Takes a lot of time to do practice problems, but my friend and I did ****loads of practice probs and the tests were easy,nothing unexpected.

Does not care about your time or money. ALWAYS LATE to class and her lectures were not always well-planned. Gives tedious assignments that are more about making sure you did the reading than advancing significant understanding or skills.

Prof Kalb was the highlight of my semester, she's the best! She's extremely kind and you can tell she really cares for her students and the content she's teaching. Her class created the most amazing sense of community during the online semester and her readings always showed a unique perspective. Her essays can be tough but worth it!

The class attendance was optional and every day was just lectures never did worksheets or activities (so it was boring). Professor Lincoln is very helpful during office hours! Exams were difficult! Make sure to do the practice problems regularly after every lecture (even though they aren't required) so that you can apply what you learned.
She made this otherwise complex subject pretty easy and even interesting. Her class is what introduced me to Philosophy, and now I am majoring in it. That says a lot.
Very conservative, do not take if you want to express your opinion.

Literally one of the most (if not THE most!!) kindest, caring professors at CMC. She makes sure classes and content are accessible and engaging to anyone, whether you're a medieval history fan or experiencing it for the first time. She made the online learning format enjoyable, which is a feat in itself.

Professor Valenza is amazing. His tests are super easy and he is a good teacher. Will never forget how he explained calculus using arts such as famous paintings. Really changed my perspective on math.
He is an amazing professor. He teaches the material very well. If you don't understand the material he taught in class, go to his office hours and you will feel confident again. TAKE HIS CLASS

AGAIN: Don't take her if you don't have to. Course is a waste of time and you will come out of class with no understanding of the material. Poorly organized structure, poor communication, and little grasp of the class dynamic. Two thumbs down.

Great teacher as long as you go in with an open mind.  His lectures are very wordy but it helps a lot when looking over your notes. Its easy to get a B in this class but hard to get an A. Overall great teacher, he will even let you text him questions about the home work.

I heard people suggest me not to take his class but it turns out to be the BEST class I had in CMC. It's totally Ok if you don't understand stuff in class, just go to the office hour. He can't be more helpful and caring. He gives me wise life advices and makes me think deeper in econ. If you are really in to econ, take him!
Super responsible, very helpful in and after class, charming.
No Comments

(Really for Theoretical Mechanics) Assigned the entire issue of "Scientific American" in 2018 for space, time and what to do with them in anthropology for the gold/black issue, which they chose at my suggestion for colors TKO-ing the topic for planet earth. Also suggested the entire feminist issue following, + "Abraham Accords" with Trump. LLeight

I cannot possibly put into words how fantastic a professor that Bassam is. My favorite professor of ALL TIME and not even an Arabic major The only caveat is that he has very high expectations of all his students. But if you are passionate, the man has seemingly infinite time, capacity, and desire to guide you in learning this awesome language.

Amazing prof. I had her for Art and Politics; it is one of my favorite classes at CMC so far. Sweet, engaging professor who's extremely knowledgeable and possesses infectious enthusiasm. Definitely take her class if you can! A lot of reading but if you commit the time, you get so much out of it!

Professor Selig is awesome.  She's warm and funny and easily approachable. She's passionate about the material and helps her students to be as well. The assigned readings for the most part are fascinating.  And I love her teaching style - very down to earth. She's definitely one of the coolest professors I've come across at the Claremont Colleges.
The worst professor, or teacher for that matter, that I've ever had. Bust of a semester.

Bradley is good if you've had math before. he's very clear and very helpful outside class. his tests are harder, but very fair. he tends to write a lot, but his explanations are very good. i would definitely take another class with him

Worst professor I have ever had. All he did was talk about how we didn't know enough math. He doesn't use the textbook hardly at all and his tests come out of nowhere. Plus he's hostile at his office hours. I regret taking the class 100%. Take Bjerk instead...

The only way I know how to describe this class is this: the other morning, I was reminded that Civ10 with Valenza is just a semester long course, not the full year, and I actually teared up. You will learn about yourself in this class. Priceless!

Bassam made me feel like our class is really a family. He's one of the funniest, kindest, and sweetest teachers I've ever had, though his class can be a little chaotic or confusing at times. Arabic is a really challenging language, but nobody loves the subject more than him. Be sure to take advantage of the tutoring hours outside of class.

Professor Coleman is fantastic! I took neurobiology with her for the GE, and even though I didn't enjoy the subject material, I learned a lot. Professor Coleman is kind, funny, and clearly passionate about science.

Uvin (former Dean of Faculty which is why he has so few ratings) is amazing! It's about development. Participation, 2 short papers (very easy), a class that you plan (pretty easy), and a longer final paper (easy bc lots of time to do it). Interesting, not long readings, and the papers are analyzing interviews and data. Highly recommend this class!

I can't stop taking his classes. Readings are engaging, relevant, and the subject matter is controversial as ever, what an exciting course! RPV is the best class I took in college and opened my eyes in ways never thought imaginable. Very committed to building his dept and making sure his students come away having learned more. Take his class!!

Take his classes if you are a psych major - you will learn a lot. His classes are not for the faint of heart; you could study for 10+ hours and it will still be hard to get an A or even A- in the class. You are graded on like 3 tests and a couple short mini papers and one long paper but he is a tough grader on all of those things.

do not take this class. it made me hate chemistry. i put a ton of time and effort into this class and it didn't pay off. class just made the material more confusing and he expected you to know material he didn't teach nor was in the book. worst professor ever. nothing about this class was good.

Professor Lofgren is a very intelligible man who has a hard time displaying the information to his students in an interesting way. Although his class is boring at times, and his tests are fairly difficult, if you take the time to get to know him it makes the class more worthwhile. He's a great guy who really cares about his students.

This course is difficult- don't get me wrong. But it would probably be easier than equivalent courses offered at HMC or Pomona. Our assignments helped build out our Github while being useful/practical. Mike clearly states that it will take 12 - 15 hours of work a week for an A- and that's pretty accurate. Put in the work and go to tutoring!!

Uses math exclusively to teach concepts.  I didn't put a whole lot of work in to the class, but I really studied for the last test and did well.  If you're willing to do outside work to study and are good with math, you'll do fine and learn some.  Funny, but digresses into material of 101.

Schroeder is the best philosophy prof. Took him for Political Philosophy and we had interesting lectures, papers, and discussions. He really does know how to properly teach philosophy and interpret really dense material - go to office hours with friends and you'll get the most out of it!

His lectures don't contribute to the tested material at all. He likes to talk about accounting and its uses, but rarely teaches the fundamentals and expects you to be able to complete the homework by learning the material yourself. For someone not familiar with accounting, this was a very difficult and frustrating class.

Prof. Frigault is super interesting and he made our 8am worth getting up for. Before each class, you have a 10-20 page reading and you answer 4 questions (2-3 sentences each) about what you found interesting + questions you have about the reading. The class is discussion-based so there are lots of opportunities to participate. Definitely recommend!
Dr. Umanath is very passionate about autobiographical memory! She can be tough in class, but is awesome to get to know!
No Comments

Overall good class and good professor. Super nice guy. His lectures are really boring despite my interest in government. I know it's just an intro class, but a bit more examples or contemporary issues and a bit less emphasis on political correctness and balance would help.
The topics we discussed and readings were always super interesting but we spent barely any time on grammar and I felt like my skills slipped a lot this semester.

I LOVE PROF YOUNG!!!  She is wonderful, animated, and, as has been noted, breaks into song and dance spontaneously!  Mind you, homework assignments sometimes go on sakai late, which is annoying.  I've taken 3 semesters of french with her and they've all been challenging with lots of homework and a tough essay grading scale -but I've loved it!

He wrote the textbook, so if you don't understand his lecture, you won't have a chance. He is a condescending prick that actually made me cry in class. I hate him with a burning passion and my class notes are filled with "I wish I could be anywhere but here" So overall, I would not recommend his class.

The only discussion based class I had freshman year. I didn't take a single note. A LOT OF READING, IMPOSSIBLE TO GET A GOOD GRADE ON THE ESSAYS, yet if you're into the topic, it is the most intellectually stimulating class you'll get. This is the class that I'm learning the most, even though its kicking my ass.

He is a great professor very kind easy to understand it is a hard course but if you read the book it's not as hard. The subject is very interesting, lots of notes are required and lots of study time for the final the study guides are long but simple if u just follow the book. The stuff he talks about in class is exactly the same as in the text.

This class is unlike any other at CMC. The war simulation is so elaborate that many non-majors were drawn in. Professor Hopper is super devoted to the simulation and went out of his way to make it the best experience. Class discussion often leads to thought-provoking moral debates. His grading is not as tough as students may think it is at first.

Her FHS Nature and society class was super interesting and engaging in my opinion (discussions about native land, and colonialism). There were only 3 essays over the course of the semester plus a group project. It is a super manageable class and not hard to get a good grade if you write about the message she wants you to get out of the readings.

Magilke is definitely one of the hardest professors at CMC and while he makes you study a lot on your own, it forces you to learn accounting. Tests are tough, but if you study in advance and put in the work, you'll get the grade you deserve. He's accessible during office hours and although can be intimidating, will answers your questions.
Too stringent with following the rules, nearly to the point of being anti-compassionate.  Reasonably clear with expectations, but not very approachable.

Requires minimal reading and little class participation. The class is structured around Lynch talking for 3 hours. Grade is determined by 3 10 page papers - which are graded easily. Interesting class, but not particularly challenging.

This man was a little scatter-brained at times and the class was more lecture-based than most FHS classes, but we definitely read some interesting stuff and he is so knowledgeable. Take him if you're looking for an easy A--most lenient grader ever. He's also willing to help on papers. Definitely going to take another class with him!

Professor Locke is an amazing Professor.  It is true that he has high expectations but his goal is not to weed people out of his class.  He genuinely loos for the best in his students and helps you to understand your strengths as well.  He is also really entertaining.  I never missed class once because I would rather be there than not.

there is only a midterm, final and one term paper. He assignes a ton of reading but there is no need to do it all

Professor Filson is a bit of a stickler when it comes to grading, but the coursework is interesting and he teaches it well. Tests are easy if you study, it is mostly memorization. 3 midterms and 1 paper.
Cool guy, but relies too heavily on philisophical theories and less on inspire though which makes the essays hard.

A solid choice for a math professor. It is obvious professor Nelson is passionate about mathematics and you can see his face light up when he gets going on something. Really humble guy, make use of his office hours he is ready to help. Professor Nelson has his own textbook for this class and it is AMAZING. I reference it constantly.

Amazing teacher who makes you fall in love with the subject!  She is always there to help and expects you to make an effort. All this results in you becoming a better writer while having fun.  She made me want to become a history major.
Amazing Prof. Her lectures are very clear and she follows the syllabus completely. Really good if you've never taken econ before. Extremely organized.

Professor Espinosa's class was easy enough but extremely boring. He talks a lot, it was all lecture and I would not recommend it. There are also papers due every two weeks that just felt like busy work.
Gonzales is a great guy! The class is so fun, and he really cares about the students. I recommend him to everyone taking Spanish at CMC.

One of the worst professors I've ever taken. Rude, not interest in students or their learning. If she doesn't like you, she will make your life hell--and she doesnt seem to like anyone. Made fun of an Asian kid in the class for squinting more than one time. Totally nuts.
Professor Sinclair is the man. Very helpful, funny, and clear. Can not recommend one of his classes enough if you want to get inspired about politics and public policy.

This was a difficult class and Prof Cohen made us really work for the A but he is a great professor. He is clear about his expectations and he genuinely wants us to do well. He tries to accommodate us for office hours so he is very accessible. He explained concepts really well and I would take class with him again if he hadn't left!

Very knowledgeable, animated, and intimidating (scary, especially during online office hours.) Lots of reading and writing. He is especially straightforward with his feedback- he tells you exactly what you did wrong and what you need to improve upon (can be a breath of fresh air or harsh.) Overall, great professor.
Simple the WORST! Talked about topology all the time! God I'm here to learn Calculus!

Juvenile delinquency is an interesting topic, but this course taught me nothing. It was mostly logic and people telling irrelevant personal stories. Grade is based only on two (annoying and long). It's an easy A and a seminar, but your time is better spent in other classes.

Military and Politics in LA=My favorite class at CMC!  Heavy reading and discussion in the beginning, but no class whenever you have an assignment due (research design then the final seminar paper at the end)!  The last 3 classes were at his house...2 days of presentations then 1 just hanging out and eating brownies (the best ever!)
